summary.en: Preabdomen means the anterior (front) part of the abdomen in certain arthropods, especially scorpions.
summary.zh: preabdomen 指某些节肢动物（尤指蝎子）腹部的前段，即靠近胸部的部分。

definition.en: (In zoology, especially in scorpions and some other arthropods) the front/anterior part of the abdomen; the abdominal segments closest to the thorax.
definition.zh: （动物学用语，尤指蝎子等节肢动物）前腹；腹部靠近胸部的前段（前部体节）。

examples.en: In scorpions, the preabdomen is broader than the tail-like rear section.
examples.zh: 在蝎子中，前腹比后面尾状的部分更宽。

examples.en: The researcher described the preabdomen segments in the species identification notes.
examples.zh: 研究者在物种鉴定记录中描述了该生物的前腹体节。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前/前面的”，加上“abdomen（腹部）”构成“preabdomen（前腹）”，多见于动物学、昆虫学或蛛形纲（如蝎子）解剖描述。
在蝎子解剖里，前腹常对应 mesosoma（中腹），与后腹/尾部（常称 metasoma）相对；不同学科或文献可能用词略有差异。

summary.en: “Preabsorb” means to absorb something beforehand, before a later process or use.
summary.zh: “preabsorb”表示在后续过程或使用之前先进行吸收（预先吸收）。

definition.en: to absorb something in advance; to take in (e.g., liquid, information, shock) before a later step or process.
definition.zh: 预先吸收；在后续步骤之前先吸收（如液体、信息、冲击等）。

examples.en: Some sponges are designed to preabsorb water so they don’t drip during use.
examples.zh: 有些海绵被设计成能预先吸收水分，这样使用时就不会滴水。

examples.en: The material can preabsorb oil, helping the filter work more efficiently later.
examples.zh: 这种材料可以预先吸收油分，帮助过滤器之后更高效地工作。

examples.en: In training, you try to preabsorb key vocabulary before the lesson starts.
examples.zh: 在训练中，你会在课程开始前先预先吸收一些核心词汇。

extraExplanation: “preabsorb”由前缀 pre-（预先）+ absorb（吸收）构成，语义很直观，但在日常英语里不算常见。更自然的表达常用 “absorb in advance / absorb beforehand / pre-soak（预浸）/ pre-load（预载入）/ pre-treat（预处理）”，具体取决于语境（材料、化学、工程、学习等）。

summary.en: Preabsorbent describes something made to absorb liquid or another substance ahead of time or in an earlier stage.
summary.zh: preabsorbent 用来形容“在更早阶段就先吸收”的材料或设计。

definition.en: able to absorb something in advance or before another stage or process; designed to take up liquid or another substance early
definition.zh: 预先吸收的；能在后续步骤之前先吸收（液体或其他物质）的；用于提前吸收的

examples.en: The package includes a preabsorbent pad to soak up moisture before shipping.
examples.zh: 包装里有一块预先吸收垫，用来在运输前吸走水分。

examples.en: In the experiment, a preabsorbent layer reduced the amount of water reaching the sensor.
examples.zh: 在实验中，预先吸收层减少了到达传感器的水量。

extraExplanation: 这个词由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ absorbent（“吸收性的；吸收材料”）构成。实际使用中常见写法是带连字符的 pre-absorbent，更多出现在工程、包装、医疗敷料、材料科学等语境中，用来强调“先一步吸收/预处理吸收”的功能。

summary.en: “Preabstract” is an uncommon word meaning “before abstraction” (adj.) or “to make an abstract in advance” (v.).
summary.zh: “preabstract”较少见，可指“抽象化之前的”（形容词）或“预先做摘要/提炼”（动词）。

definition.en: (Uncommon) Existing, happening, or done before something is made abstract; “before abstraction.”
definition.zh: （不常用）在某事被抽象化之前就存在/发生的；“抽象之前的”。

examples.en: The paper discusses preabstract experience—what we feel before we form theories about it.
examples.zh: 这篇论文讨论“抽象之前的经验”——也就是我们在形成理论之前的感受。

examples.en: In class, we start with preabstract examples and then move to formulas.
examples.zh: 在课堂上，我们先从抽象之前的例子开始，然后再进入公式。

definition.en: (Uncommon, technical) To abstract or summarize in advance; to make an abstract beforehand.
definition.zh: （不常用，技术性）预先做摘要/提炼；在前面先进行抽象概括。

examples.en: Some editors preabstract articles to help readers decide what to read.
examples.zh: 有些编辑会先给文章做预摘要，帮助读者决定要不要读。

examples.en: The system can preabstract key points from long reports.
examples.zh: 该系统可以从长报告中预先提炼要点。

extraExplanation: “preabstract”不是日常英语里的常用词，更常见的表达是“pre-abstract (adj.) / preliminary (adj.) / prior to abstraction (phrase)”或动词“summarize in advance / create an abstract beforehand”。
前缀“pre-”表示“在……之前”，词根“abstract”可指“抽象的（adj.）/摘要（n.）/做摘要（v.）”。在学术写作语境里，读者更常看到“pre-abstracted”或直接用“abstract (n.)”来表示论文摘要。

summary.en: Preabundance is a rare/nonstandard noun meaning an abundance that already exists beforehand.
summary.zh: preabundance 是一个少见/不太规范的名词，指“事先就存在的丰足（提前就很充足）”。

definition.en: A very rare or nonstandard word meaning an abundance that exists beforehand; more than enough supply before something happens or is needed.
definition.zh: 非常少见或不太规范的词，表示“事先就存在的丰足/富余”；在某事发生或需要之前就已经“多到用不完”的状态。

examples.en: The pantry’s preabundance of canned food made the storm less stressful.
examples.zh: 储藏室里事先就有大量罐头食品，让暴风雨来临时没那么紧张。

examples.en: Because of the preabundance of resources, the team could experiment freely.
examples.zh: 由于资源事先就很充足，团队可以更自由地做实验。

extraExplanation: “preabundance”在现代英语里非常罕见，很多词典不收录；更常见、自然的表达通常是“abundance in advance / an ample supply beforehand / a surplus already on hand”。
构词上可理解为 pre-（在……之前）+ abundance（丰富、充足）。如果你在阅读中遇到它，多半是作者为了强调“提前就很充足”而临时造的词（nonce word）。

summary.en: “Preabundant” means extremely abundant or more than enough, but it is rare/old-fashioned in modern English.
summary.zh: “preabundant”表示“极其丰富、绰绰有余”，但在现代英语中较少见、偏古旧。

definition.en: Very abundant; present in more than enough quantity (an uncommon or old-fashioned word).
definition.zh: 非常丰富的；多到绰绰有余的（较少见或偏古旧的用法）。

examples.en: The river valley had preabundant vegetation after weeks of rain.
examples.zh: 连续下了几周雨后，河谷里的植被变得异常茂盛。

examples.en: In some regions, preabundant sunlight makes solar power especially practical.
examples.zh: 在一些地区，充足到绰绰有余的日照让太阳能特别实用。

extraExplanation: 这个词非常少见，现代英语里更常用 abundant（丰富的）、plentiful（充足的）、more than enough（绰绰有余的）或 superabundant（极其丰富的）。
词形上是 pre- + abundant。这里的 pre- 属于较古旧/不常见的强化用法（并非“在……之前”的时间含义），因此容易让学习者误解。

summary.en: “Preabundantly” means “very abundantly; more than enough,” but it is rare in modern English.
summary.zh: “preabundantly”意为“极其丰富地、绰绰有余地”，但在现代英语中非常少见。

definition.en: In a very abundant way; more than enough; exceedingly.
definition.zh: 极其丰富地；多到绰绰有余地；非常充裕地。

examples.en: The garden produced preabundantly after weeks of rain.
examples.zh: 连下几周雨后，花园的收成极其丰盛。

examples.en: They thanked the volunteers, who had given their time preabundantly.
examples.zh: 他们感谢志愿者，因为大家付出了大量时间，远超所需。

extraExplanation: “preabundantly”非常罕见，多见于较旧或较正式的文字；现代英语更常用“abundantly / richly / exceedingly / more than enough”。
它容易被误写或误读为“preponderantly”（主要地、占优势地）或“superabundantly”（极其充足地）。如果你是在校对或写作，通常可以把它改成更常见的表达以避免困惑。

summary.en: “Preaccept” means to accept something in advance, before a final decision or full review.
summary.zh: “preaccept”指在最终决定或完整审核之前先行接受/初步同意。

definition.en: to accept (something or someone) in advance, before the usual final review or official decision
definition.zh: 预先接受；提前同意（在正式审核或最终决定之前）

examples.en: The program may preaccept students based on their grades, but the final offer depends on an interview.
examples.zh: 该项目可能会根据成绩预先接受学生，但最终录取取决于面试。

examples.en: Some lenders preaccept applicants online, then confirm the details later.
examples.zh: 一些贷款机构会在网上预先接受申请人，然后再核实细节。

extraExplanation: “preaccept”在日常口语中不算常见，更常写作带连字符的“pre-accept”，或改用更自然的表达如“accept in advance / give preliminary approval”。
常见语境包括招生录取、贷款/信用卡、申请审核等：表示“初步同意”，但通常仍可能需要后续材料或复核。

summary.en: Preacceptance means an advance or preliminary acceptance/approval before something is finalized.
summary.zh: Preacceptance 指在最终确定之前给予的预先接受或初步批准。

definition.en: the act of accepting something in advance, or an approval given before final review or completion
definition.zh: 预先接受；预先批准（在最终审核或完成之前的同意）

examples.en: The insurer gave preacceptance of the claim, pending final documents.
examples.zh: 保险公司对理赔进行了预先批准，但仍需提交最终文件。

examples.en: We received preacceptance for the proposal, so we can begin planning.
examples.zh: 我们的方案获得了预先接受，所以可以开始规划了。

extraExplanation: 这个词多见于较正式的语境（如保险、金融、学术投稿、项目管理），表示“先同意/先通过，但还要等后续条件满足”。含义通常带有“暂定、以最终结果为准（pending final approval）”的感觉。
构词：pre-（在……之前）+ acceptance（接受/认可）。日常口语里更常说 early acceptance / preliminary approval / conditional acceptance（有条件的接受）。

summary.en: Preacceptances are early or conditional acceptances given before all final conditions are confirmed.
summary.zh: preacceptances 指在最终条件确认前给出的提前或有条件的接受/录取。

definition.en: acceptances given in advance (often before final conditions are met), such as an early/conditional approval or admission.
definition.zh: 预先给出的接受（常指在最终条件尚未完全满足前的提前/有条件同意或录取）。

examples.en: The university sent out preacceptances to strong applicants, pending final transcripts.
examples.zh: 这所大学向优秀申请者发出了预录取通知，但需等最终成绩单确认。

examples.en: Several preacceptances were later withdrawn when the requirements weren’t met.
examples.zh: 有几份预先接受后来因未满足要求而被撤回。

extraExplanation: “preacceptances”是复数形式，单数是“preacceptance”。在教育场景里常接近“conditional acceptance（有条件录取）/early acceptance（提前录取）”，但不一定完全等同：preacceptance更强调“先同意，后核实/补齐条件”。
在正式写作中也可写作“pre-acceptance / pre-acceptances”（带连字符），是否加连字符取决于机构或出版风格。

summary.en: “Preaccepted” means approved or accepted in advance, often conditionally.
summary.zh: “preaccepted”指“预先接受/预先批准”，通常带有“仍需最终审核”的含义。

definition.en: accepted or approved in advance (often before all final checks are completed).
definition.zh: 预先接受的；预先批准的（常指在最终审核完成前先给予同意/批准）。

examples.en: You’re preaccepted for a credit card, but the final approval depends on your income details.
examples.zh: 你已获得信用卡的预先核准，但最终是否批准还取决于你的收入资料。

examples.en: The university said my application was preaccepted pending official transcripts.
examples.zh: 大学表示我的申请已预先录取，但需补交正式成绩单。

definition.en: (business/administrative) already accepted as valid or eligible, so it can be processed more quickly later.
definition.zh: （商业/行政）已预先认定有效或符合资格，因此后续可更快办理。

examples.en: Preaccepted documents can be uploaded without additional verification.
examples.zh: 预先认可的文件可直接上传，无需额外验证。

examples.en: The system flags preaccepted vendors for faster payment processing.
examples.zh: 系统会标记已预先通过审核的供应商，以便更快付款。

extraExplanation: 在美式英语里更常见的写法是带连字符的 **pre-accepted**（或作为过去分词用：**was pre-accepted**）。在金融广告中看到 “You’re preaccepted” 通常表示“初步符合条件”，并不等于最终一定获批；具体仍以信用审查、收入与身份核验等结果为准。

summary.en: “Preaccepting” means accepting something ahead of final review or approval.
summary.zh: “preaccepting”指在最终审核/批准前先行接受或同意。

definition.en: accepting something in advance (before a final decision, review, or formal approval).
definition.zh: 预先接受；在最终决定、审核或正式批准之前先行同意/接受。

examples.en: The university warned applicants not to assume that a message means the school is preaccepting them.
examples.zh: 大学提醒申请者不要以为收到一条消息就表示学校已经预先录取他们。

examples.en: We are preaccepting reservations, but your booking is confirmed only after payment.
examples.zh: 我们可以先预接收预约，但只有付款后才算正式确认。

definition.en: informally, treating an offer or request as already agreed to before hearing full details.
definition.zh: （非正式）在听完细节前就先当作已经同意；先入为主地接受。

examples.en: Try not to start preaccepting the plan until you read the terms.
examples.zh: 在你读完条款前，尽量别先入为主地接受这个方案。

extraExplanation: “preaccepting”是动词“preaccept”的现在分词/动名词形式（pre- + accept）。它不是非常常见，更常见的写法是带连字符的“pre-accepting”，尤其在正式写作里。
常见语境：教育录取（pre-accept / pre-admit）、预约/订单（先收但未最终确认）、保险/贷款（pre-acceptance / pre-approval 相关概念）。如果强调“正式批准前的原则同意”，英语里也常用“pre-approve / preapproval”。

summary.en: “Preaccepts” means “accepts in advance,” often before a final confirmation.
summary.zh: “preaccepts”意为“预先接受/提前同意”，通常在最终确认之前。

definition.en: to accept (someone or something) in advance, before a final review, event, or formal confirmation
definition.zh: 预先接受；提前同意（在最终审核、事件发生或正式确认之前）

examples.en: The program preaccepts applicants who meet the minimum GPA requirement.
examples.zh: 该项目会预先接受达到最低绩点要求的申请者。

examples.en: Our system preaccepts the payment and then runs an additional security check.
examples.zh: 我们的系统会先预先接受付款，然后再进行额外的安全检查。

extraExplanation: “preaccept(s)”由前缀 pre-（“预先、在……之前”）+ accept 组成，常见于较正式的场景（如录取、资格审核、支付流程），表示“先给出同意/接受的决定”，但后续仍可能有最终确认或补充条件。
日常口语里更常用的表达是 “accept in advance / approve in advance / give preliminary approval（初步批准）”。

summary.en: Preaccess means getting or giving early access before the official release or opening.
summary.zh: preaccess 指在正式发布或开放前的提前访问/抢先体验（也可作形容词或较少见的动词用法）。

definition.en: early or advance access to something before it is officially available to the public
definition.zh: （在正式公开/发布前的）提前进入权；抢先体验

examples.en: Players who buy the deluxe edition get preaccess to the new map.
examples.zh: 购买豪华版的玩家可以抢先体验新地图。

examples.en: The museum offered preaccess tickets for members the night before the opening.
examples.zh: 博物馆为会员提供开幕前一晚的提前入场票。

definition.en: available in advance; giving early access before the official release or opening
definition.zh: 可提前获取的；提供抢先体验的

examples.en: Preaccess content is limited and may change before launch.
examples.zh: 抢先体验内容有限，并且可能在正式上线前发生变化。

examples.en: They sent a preaccess link to a small group of testers.
examples.zh: 他们把提前访问链接发给了一小部分测试人员。

definition.en: to access something in advance (often used in technical/computing contexts)
definition.zh: （多用于技术/计算语境）预先访问；提前读取

examples.en: The app preaccesses frequently used files to load faster.
examples.zh: 该应用会预先读取常用文件以加快加载速度。

extraExplanation: “preaccess”更常见的写法是带连字符的“pre-access”，尤其在市场宣传、游戏与软件产品里，意思接近“early access / advanced access（抢先体验/提前访问）”。在正式写作中也常用“early access”来表达更自然。
在技术文档里，动词用法较少见，但可表示“提前读取/预取（prefetch）”一类的优化思路；若要更地道，很多场景会直接用“prefetch”。

summary.en: Preaccessible means “accessible in advance” or “already made accessible beforehand,” usually in technical contexts.
summary.zh: preaccessible 指“可提前访问的/已预先开放访问的”，多用于技术语境。

definition.en: able to be accessed or reached beforehand; already made accessible in advance (often used in technical writing, and sometimes written with a hyphen: pre-accessible).
definition.zh: 可在事先被访问/进入的；已提前设为可访问的（多见于技术语境，有时写作 pre-accessible）。

examples.en: The documents were preaccessible to reviewers one week before the meeting.
examples.zh: 会议前一周，这些文件就已提前对评审开放访问。

examples.en: For security reasons, only a small set of pages are pre-accessible without logging in.
examples.zh: 出于安全原因，只有少量页面在未登录时可提前访问。

extraExplanation: “preaccessible”并不是非常常见的日常英语词，更常见的表达是 “accessible in advance / available ahead of time”。在计算机、网络安全、数据权限等领域，为了强调“预先开放（访问权限）”的概念，作者可能会造出或使用这个复合词。
拼写上常见两种：不加连字符的 preaccessible 与带连字符的 pre-accessible；带连字符在正式技术写作中更清晰。

summary.en: Preaccidental means “before an accident,” and rarely (in music) “a warning accidental shown in advance.”
summary.zh: preaccidental 指“事故发生前的”；少见地也可指（音乐中）“提前提示的变化音记号”。

definition.en: Happening or existing before an accident or unintended harmful event; earlier than an accident.
definition.zh: 发生在事故（或意外伤害事件）之前的；事故前的。

examples.en: The report included preaccidental safety conditions, such as poor lighting and missing signs.
examples.zh: 报告包含了事故发生前的安全状况，比如照明不足和缺少标志。

examples.en: Investigators compared preaccidental and postaccidental photos of the site.
examples.zh: 调查人员对比了事故前与事故后的现场照片。

definition.en: (Music, rare) Describing an accidental sign (sharp/flat/natural) shown in advance as a warning, often to prevent misreading.
definition.zh: （音乐用语，较少见）指提前标出的“变化音记号”（升/降/还原），用于提醒演奏者，避免看错。

examples.en: The editor added a preaccidental to warn players about the upcoming F-sharp.
examples.zh: 编辑加了一个提前的变化音记号，提醒演奏者接下来是F升。

extraExplanation: 这个词非常少见，多见于技术写作（如事故分析、工程安全、法医/调查报告）中，用来把“事故发生前的状态或因素”单独拎出来讨论。日常英语里更常用的表达是 “before the accident” 或 “pre-accident (conditions)”。
音乐含义属于边缘用法：英语里更常见的说法是 “cautionary accidental”（提示性变化音），或 “courtesy accidental”（礼貌变化音）。

summary.en: “Preaccidentally” is a very rare/nonstandard adverb meaning “before an accident.” In most writing, use “before the accident,” “prior to the accident,” or “pre-accident (adj.).”
summary.zh: “preaccidentally”是非常少见/不规范的副词，大意为“事故发生之前”。更常用的表达是“before/prior to the accident”，或用形容词“pre-accident（事故前的）”。

definition.en: (Very rare/nonstandard) Before an accident; prior to an accident happening.
definition.zh: （非常少见/不规范用法）在事故发生之前；事故前。

examples.en: The report compares preaccidentally collected data with post-accident results.
examples.zh: 报告将事故前收集的数据与事故后的结果进行比较。

examples.en: She described how the machine behaved preaccidentally and what changed afterward.
examples.zh: 她描述了机器在事故发生前的表现，以及之后发生了哪些变化。

extraExplanation:
“preaccidentally”在日常英语里几乎不用，读者可能会觉得别扭或看不懂。更自然的表达通常是：
- “before the accident”/“prior to the accident”（事故前）
- “pre-accident”作形容词：pre-accident condition/data（事故前的状况/数据）
如果一定要用“pre-”前缀，常见写法更像是“pre-accident”而不是“preaccidentally”。
构词上可以理解为 pre-（在……之前）+ accidentally（意外地），但语义会变得不清晰：读者可能误以为是“在意外发生之前（就意外地……）”。在写作中建议改用更直接的时间表达。

summary.en: Preaccommodate means to make arrangements in advance to accommodate someone or something later.
summary.zh: preaccommodate 指“提前安排/提前准备”，以便之后能接待、安置或满足需求。

definition.en: to arrange or provide something in advance so that someone or something will be accommodated later
definition.zh: （提前）安排或准备好，使某人/某事之后能被安置、接待或满足需求

examples.en: The hotel tried to preaccommodate guests by preparing extra rooms for late arrivals.
examples.zh: 酒店试图提前安排，为晚到的客人准备额外的房间。

examples.en: We preaccommodated the new staff by setting up their accounts before their first day.
examples.zh: 我们在新员工入职前就把账号都提前开通好了。

extraExplanation: “preaccommodate”由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ accommodate（“容纳/满足/照顾”）构成，字面意思就是“提前容纳/提前安排”。
这个词在日常英语里非常少见，很多时候更自然的说法是：prepare in advance（提前准备）、make arrangements beforehand（事先安排）、accommodate in advance（提前安排接待）、prearrange（预先安排）。

summary.en: Preaccommodated means lodging or facilities have already been arranged in advance.
summary.zh: preaccommodated 指住宿或相关安排已提前准备好、预先安置好的。

definition.en: (especially of housing, travel, or events) arranged in advance so that lodging or facilities are already provided.
definition.zh: （尤指住宿、旅行或活动）已事先安排好住宿或相关设施的；预先安置好的。

examples.en: The program is for preaccommodated students, so you don’t need to look for an apartment.
examples.zh: 这个项目面向已预先安排好住宿的学生，所以你不需要再找公寓。

examples.en: All participants will be preaccommodated near the conference center.
examples.zh: 所有参会者都会被预先安排在会议中心附近住宿。

definition.en: (technical, less common) having already adjusted focus (accommodation), especially in optics or vision contexts.
definition.zh: （技术用语，较少见）已完成调焦（眼调节/镜头调节）的；预先处于某一对焦状态的。

examples.en: In some tests, a preaccommodated eye may respond differently to sudden changes in distance.
examples.zh: 在某些测试中，预先处于调焦状态的眼睛对距离突然变化的反应可能不同。

extraExplanation: 这个词在日常英语里不算常见，更常见的表达是 “accommodation is provided / housing is arranged / pre-arranged housing”。写作中也常见带连字符的形式 “pre-accommodated”。
构词上是前缀 pre-（“预先”）+ accommodate（“为……提供住宿/使适应”）+ -ed，作为过去分词形容词使用。

summary.en: Preaccommodating means being accommodating in advance—making preparations beforehand (rare; sometimes used in technical vision contexts).
summary.zh: preaccommodating 指“预先体贴/提前安排周到”（较少见；有时用于视觉相关技术语境）。

definition.en: (Rare) Making arrangements in advance to meet someone’s needs; accommodating beforehand.
definition.zh: （少见）提前为满足他人需求而做安排；预先体贴周到地准备。

examples.en: The hotel was preaccommodating and placed a crib in our room before we arrived.
examples.zh: 这家酒店很预先周到，我们到达前就把婴儿床放进了房间。

examples.en: To be preaccommodating, the host asked about dietary restrictions a week ahead.
examples.zh: 为了做到预先周到，主人提前一周询问了饮食禁忌。

definition.en: (Technical, vision/medicine) Related to adjusting focus in advance, before a visual task or stimulus.
definition.zh: （技术用语，视觉/医学）与在进行视觉任务或刺激之前提前调节焦距有关的。

examples.en: Some papers discuss preaccommodating responses when viewers anticipate a near target.
examples.zh: 一些论文讨论当观看者预期近处目标时出现的提前调焦反应。

extraExplanation: “preaccommodating”在日常英语中非常不常见，更常见的表达是“accommodating”（体贴/好相处）或“make arrangements in advance”（提前安排）。
写作中常见到带连字符的形式“pre-accommodating”，更容易让读者一眼看懂“pre-（预先）+ accommodating（体贴/安排周到）”。
如果你想表达“提前为某人腾出时间/房间/资源”，更自然的说法有：“We arranged it ahead of time.” / “We prepared in advance.”

summary.en: “Preaccommodatingly” means doing something in an overly helpful way in advance, before anyone asks.
summary.zh: “preaccommodatingly”表示“在别人开口之前就先（有时过度）体贴/迎合地去满足对方需求”的方式。

definition.en: In a way that tries to meet someone’s needs in advance (sometimes too eagerly), before the person has even asked.
definition.zh: 以“预先迎合/预先照顾”的方式（有时带一点过度热心的意味），在对方还没提出要求前就先替对方安排好。

examples.en: The hotel staff preaccommodatingly set out allergy-friendly snacks before we mentioned any dietary needs.
examples.zh: 酒店员工预先照顾地摆好了无过敏风险的零食，我们还没提到任何饮食需求。

examples.en: He preaccommodatingly apologized for a problem that hadn’t happened yet.
examples.zh: 他预先迎合地为一个还没发生的问题道歉。

examples.en: She spoke preaccommodatingly, offering help before anyone could respond.
examples.zh: 她说话带着预先照顾的语气，在别人来得及回应前就先提出要帮忙。

extraExplanation: 这个词非常少见，多见于较正式或玩味的写作中。构词上是 pre-（“预先”）+ accommodate（“照顾/满足需求”）+ -ingly（副词后缀）。语感上常暗示“过度体贴、先替别人做决定”，因此在某些语境里略带负面评价。

summary.en: Preaccommodation means accommodation arranged in advance, or (in evolution) a preexisting trait that later becomes useful for a new function.
summary.zh: preaccommodation 可指“预先安排/预订住宿”，也可指进化中的“预适应/外适应”：既有特征后来被用于新功能。

definition.en: the act of arranging housing or lodging in advance; accommodation made beforehand
definition.zh: 预先安排住宿；提前订好的住处

examples.en: For large conferences, preaccommodation is often required months ahead.
examples.zh: 大型会议通常需要提前几个月预订住宿。

examples.en: The tour package includes flights, meals, and preaccommodation near the old town.
examples.zh: 该旅游套餐包含机票、餐食，以及靠近老城区的预订住宿。

definition.en: (biology, evolution) an existing trait that happens to fit a new environment or function and later becomes useful there; similar to preadaptation/exaptation
definition.zh: （生物/进化）某种既有特征在新环境或新用途下“刚好适用”，后来被利用并发展；近似于“预适应/外适应”

examples.en: Some researchers describe feathers as a preaccommodation for flight.
examples.zh: 一些研究者认为羽毛是飞行的“预适应/外适应”基础。

examples.en: In evolutionary discussions, preaccommodation helps explain how new functions can arise from old features.
examples.zh: 在进化讨论中，“预适应”有助于解释新功能如何从旧特征中产生。

extraExplanation: 这个词在现代英语里比较少见，更常见的写法是带连字符的 pre-accommodation，尤其在“提前订住宿”的语境中。
进化生物学语境里，它常被更常用的术语 preadaptation 或 exaptation 取代；不同学者对两者细微差别的用法不完全一致。

summary.en: “Preaccomplish” means to complete something ahead of time (rare word).
summary.zh: “preaccomplish”表示“提前完成”（较少见的词）。

definition.en: (rare) To accomplish or complete something in advance; to finish before it is officially required or expected.
definition.zh: （罕见用法）提前完成；在正式需要或预期之前把某事做完。

examples.en: The team tried to preaccomplish the paperwork before the busy season.
examples.zh: 团队尽量在旺季前把文件工作提前完成。

examples.en: By preaccomplishing a few tasks, she felt less stressed on launch day.
examples.zh: 提前完成一些任务后，她在发布当天压力小了很多。

extraExplanation: “preaccomplish”在现代英语中非常少见，很多情况下更自然的表达是：finish ahead of time / complete in advance / get it done early。
有时会写作“pre-accomplish”（带连字符），但在正式写作中仍建议用更常见的替代表达，以免读者觉得不地道或难懂。

summary.en: A rare/nonstandard word meaning a prior achievement or something accomplished in advance.
summary.zh: 一个罕见且不太规范的词，意思是“先前的成就/预先完成的成果”。

definition.en: (Rare, nonstandard) An accomplishment or achievement that happens beforehand; a prior achievement.
definition.zh: （罕见、非标准用法）预先完成的成就；先前的成果。

examples.en: Her early publications were seen as a kind of preaccomplishment that made later awards feel inevitable.
examples.zh: 她早期的发表作品被视为一种“预先的成就”，使后来的获奖显得顺理成章。

examples.en: The team treated the pilot test as a preaccomplishment before the official launch.
examples.zh: 团队把试点测试当作正式上线前的一个“预先成果”。

extraExplanation: “preaccomplishment”在现代英语里非常少见，很多情况下会被认为是不自然或不规范的造词。更常用、更地道的表达是：prior accomplishment / earlier achievement / preliminary success / a head start（视语境而定）。
构词上可以理解为前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ accomplishment（“成就、完成”）。在正式写作中通常建议改用更常见的搭配，而不是自行拼出这个词。

summary.en: A preaccord is a preliminary agreement made before a final, formal deal.
summary.zh: preaccord 指在最终正式协议之前达成的初步协议/预先约定。

definition.en: a preliminary or prior agreement reached before a final contract or official decision
definition.zh: （在最终合同或正式决定之前达成的）预先协议、初步约定

examples.en: The two sides reached a preaccord on the main points before drafting the full treaty.
examples.zh: 双方在起草完整条约之前，就主要要点达成了预先协议。

examples.en: Our preaccord covers the budget range, but the timeline is still open.
examples.zh: 我们的初步约定包括预算范围，但时间表仍未确定。

extraExplanation: “preaccord”在现代英语里相对少见，常见于外交、法律或商业谈判语境，用来强调“先把关键原则谈定”，之后再补齐细节并签署正式协议。
它常被视为源自法语“préaccord”（pré- 表示“预先”，accord 表示“协议/一致”）。在日常英语中更常用的说法是“preliminary agreement”“prior agreement”“understanding”或“memorandum of understanding (MOU)”。

summary.en: a prior agreement made before the main agreement or action
summary.zh: 在主要协议或行动之前达成的事先协议/预先约定

definition.en: a prior agreement or understanding made before a main contract, decision, or event; pre-agreement
definition.zh: （在主要合同、决定或事件之前达成的）事先协议；预先约定

examples.en: The deal was based on a preaccordance between the two companies about pricing.
examples.zh: 这笔交易建立在两家公司关于定价的事先协议之上。

examples.en: They reached a preaccordance to keep the talks confidential before signing anything.
examples.zh: 在签署任何文件之前，他们先达成了对谈判保密的预先约定。

extraExplanation: “preaccordance”在现代英语中非常少见，多见于法律/正式文本里，含义通常等同于“prior agreement / pre-agreement / preliminary understanding”。日常表达更常用：prior agreement（事先协议）、prearrangement（预先安排）、understanding（共识/默契）。
词形上可理解为 pre-（在……之前）+ accordance（符合、一致；协议）。在写作中若担心读者不熟悉，建议改用更常见的同义表达。

summary.en: “Preaccount” is a rare term meaning to record or create an accounting entry in advance, or the temporary record itself.
summary.zh: “preaccount”较少见，指提前做账/预入账，或指那条临时的预记账记录。

definition.en: (Rare / nonstandard) To record, assign, or estimate an account entry in advance (before the final accounting is done).
definition.zh: （少见/非标准用法）在正式入账完成前，先行记录、分配或预估一笔账目（预入账）。

examples.en: The finance team preaccounted the expense so the project report could be closed on time.
examples.zh: 为了按时结项，财务团队先把这笔费用做了预入账。

examples.en: We preaccount charges each week and reconcile them at month-end.
examples.zh: 我们每周先预入账费用，月末再对账。

definition.en: A preliminary account record or temporary accounting entry made before final posting (often written as “pre-account” or described as a “provisional entry”).
definition.zh: 正式过账前的临时账目/预记账分录（常写作“pre-account”，也常称“暂记/预提分录”）。

examples.en: Create a preaccount for the supplier invoice until the goods receipt is confirmed.
examples.zh: 在确认收货前，先为供应商发票建立一条预记账记录。

examples.en: The system stores the pre-account entry separately from the final ledger posting.
examples.zh: 系统会把预记账分录与最终总账过账分开存放。

extraExplanation: “preaccount”不是常见的标准英语词，更常见的表达是：provisional entry（暂记分录）、preliminary accounting（初步核算）、pre-book / pre-post（预记/预过账）。在部分行业系统（如财务软件、计费/电信系统文档）里可能会把“pre-”和“account”组合成术语使用。

summary.en: Preaccounting refers to preparatory study or the stage before formal accounting recording/reporting.
summary.zh: preaccounting指会计的预备学习/先修课程，或正式会计记录与报表之前的阶段工作。

definition.en: (In education) preparatory study or coursework that comes before formal accounting classes.
definition.zh: （教育领域）进入正式会计课程之前的预备学习/先修课程。

examples.en: She took a preaccounting course to build a foundation before starting Accounting 101.
examples.zh: 她先上了preaccounting（会计预备）课程，为会计101打基础。

examples.en: The community college offers preaccounting for students who are new to business math and bookkeeping.
examples.zh: 这所社区大学为刚接触商业数学和簿记的学生开设preaccounting课程。

definition.en: Relating to the stage or tasks that happen before accounting work is formally recorded or reported.
definition.zh: 与“正式记账/会计记录或报表”之前的阶段或工作相关的。

examples.en: They reviewed the preaccounting documents before entering transactions into the system.
examples.zh: 他们在把交易录入系统前先审核了preaccounting阶段的资料。

examples.en: Good preaccounting checks can reduce errors later in the monthly close.
examples.zh: 做好preaccounting阶段的检查能减少月结时的错误。

extraExplanation: “preaccounting”更常见的写法是带连字符的“pre-accounting”，尤其是在课程名称或教学大纲里。
在日常英语中它不是一个非常固定、普遍的词；很多场景也会改用“accounting prep / introductory accounting / bookkeeping basics”等更常见表达。

summary.en: Preaccredit means to grant approval or recognition in advance, often before full, formal accreditation is finished.
summary.zh: Preaccredit 指在正式认证完成前先行批准或认可，常用于机构或行政语境。

definition.en: to approve or recognize (a person, program, or organization) in advance, especially before a formal accreditation process is completed
definition.zh: 在正式认证完成之前，提前给予（个人、项目或机构）认可/批准；预先认证

examples.en: The agency will preaccredit the new program so students can enroll while the full review is underway.
examples.zh: 该机构将对新项目进行预先认证，这样在全面评审进行期间学生也可以入学。

examples.en: Some conferences preaccredit journalists who apply early.
examples.zh: 一些会议会对提前申请的记者进行预先核准（发放采访资格）。

definition.en: to give someone official permission to attend an event or enter a place before the event happens (a less common use)
definition.zh: （较少见）在活动开始前，提前授予某人进入或参加的正式许可/资格

examples.en: All staff must be preaccredited before arriving at the venue.
examples.zh: 所有工作人员必须在到达会场前完成预先核准。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前”，而“accredit”常见于教育、医疗、媒体与大型活动管理领域，指“认证/授予资格”。因此“preaccredit”多用于行政或机构文件中，日常口语更常说“approve in advance / grant provisional accreditation / pre-approve”。

summary.en: Preaccumulate means to accumulate something ahead of time, often to prepare for a later step or to simplify later calculations.
summary.zh: preaccumulate 指“预先积累/预先累加”，常用于强调为后续步骤做准备或让后续计算更简化。

definition.en: to accumulate or collect something in advance (before a later step, event, or process)
definition.zh: 预先积累；事先收集（在后续步骤、事件或流程之前）

examples.en: The company preaccumulated cash to prepare for a slow season.
examples.zh: 公司预先积累现金，以应对淡季。

examples.en: Students can preaccumulate vocabulary by reading short articles every day.
examples.zh: 学生可以通过每天读短文来预先积累词汇。

definition.en: (technical) to combine or add up values ahead of time so later calculations are faster or simpler
definition.zh: （技术用语）预先汇总/预先累加数值，以便后续计算更快或更简单

examples.en: The program preaccumulates totals for each category before generating the report.
examples.zh: 程序在生成报告前会先按类别预先汇总总数。

examples.en: Some systems preaccumulate statistics during data collection to reduce processing time later.
examples.zh: 有些系统会在采集数据时预先累积统计量，以减少后续处理时间。

extraExplanation: 这个词由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ accumulate（“积累、累加”）组成，意思很直观，但在日常英语里并不常见。更自然的替代表达包括：accumulate in advance, build up beforehand, stockpile（偏“储备”）。
在技术或流程类语境（如数据处理、报表、统计、算法）里更可能看到 preaccumulate，用来强调“为了后面更快/更方便而提前累加或汇总”。

summary.en: Preaccumulated means already accumulated beforehand.
summary.zh: preaccumulated 指“事先已经累积好的”。

definition.en: Already collected, built up, or accumulated before a particular time or event.
definition.zh: 在某个时间或事件之前就已经收集、积累或累积好的。

examples.en: The company used preaccumulated data to train the model faster.
examples.zh: 公司使用预先积累的数据来更快地训练模型。

examples.en: After years of saving, she had a preaccumulated emergency fund.
examples.zh: 多年储蓄之后，她已经有了一笔预先积累的应急资金。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“事先/在……之前”，加在“accumulated（累积的）”前，强调“不是现场临时形成的，而是提前就累起来的”。
该词多见于较正式的写作或技术/商业语境（如数据、成本、折旧、利息、库存等），日常口语里也常用“already accumulated / accumulated beforehand / previously accumulated”来表达相同意思。

summary.en: Preaccumulating means building something up in advance; it’s often used in technical or formal contexts.
summary.zh: preaccumulating 指“提前累积/预先积累”，常见于技术或较正式的语境。

definition.en: (Present participle) to gather or build up something in advance, before the main process or event happens.
definition.zh: （现在分词）在主要过程或事件发生之前，提前收集或累积（某物）。

examples.en: The program is preaccumulating user data to speed up the search later.
examples.zh: 这个程序正在预先累积用户数据，以便之后加快搜索速度。

examples.en: Plants may be preaccumulating water in their leaves before a dry season.
examples.zh: 植物可能会在旱季到来前在叶片中预先累积水分。

definition.en: (Adjective) describing something that is being built up in advance.
definition.zh: （形容词）形容“正在被提前累积/预先积累”的。

examples.en: A preaccumulating buffer can reduce delays during playback.
examples.zh: 一个预先累积的缓冲区可以减少播放时的延迟。

extraExplanation: “preaccumulating”= 前缀 pre-（预先）+ accumulate（累积）+ -ing（进行/分词）。它在日常英语里不算常见，更常出现在技术写作（如计算机、工程、数据处理）或较正式的说明中。
更常见的替代表达包括：accumulating in advance / building up beforehand / preloading（在某些技术语境中更自然）。

summary.en: Preaccumulation means an advance buildup or collection of something before a later stage or event.
summary.zh: preaccumulation 指在后续阶段或事件发生之前的“预先积累/预先聚集”。

definition.en: the act or process of building up or collecting something in advance (before a later event or stage)
definition.zh: 预先积累；预先聚集（在某个事件或阶段之前先把某物逐步累积起来）

examples.en: The company’s preaccumulation of cash helped it survive the downturn.
examples.zh: 公司事先积累现金，帮助它挺过了经济低迷期。

examples.en: In some models, preaccumulation of heat in the ocean can influence later weather patterns.
examples.zh: 在一些模型中，海洋中的热量预先积累会影响之后的天气模式。

extraExplanation: “preaccumulation”不是非常常见的日常词，更常见的写法是带连字符的“pre-accumulation”，或直接用更自然的表达：“build up in advance / prior accumulation / earlier buildup”。
在学术或技术语境（如经济学、气象学、材料科学）中更容易见到，用来强调“后续会发生某个过程/结果，而前面已经有一段积累期”。

summary.en: Preaccusation means the time or information that comes before a formal accusation, often involving suspicion or investigation but no official charge yet.
summary.zh: preaccusation 指“正式指控之前的阶段或相关说法/线索”，通常只有怀疑或调查，尚无官方指控。

definition.en: A stage or period before a formal accusation is made, when suspicion, investigation, or allegations may exist but no official charge has been filed.
definition.zh: 在正式指控提出之前的阶段或时期；此时可能存在怀疑、调查或传闻，但尚未提出官方指控。

examples.en: During the preaccusation phase, the company quietly reviewed security logs.
examples.zh: 在指控提出前的阶段，公司悄悄地查看了安全日志。

examples.en: He worried that rumors in the preaccusation period would damage his reputation.
examples.zh: 他担心在指控前的传闻期会损害他的名誉。

definition.en: The ideas, statements, or evidence that appear before and may lead to an accusation; early allegations or grounds for blaming someone.
definition.zh: 在指控之前出现、并可能导致指控的说法、线索或证据；早期的指控依据或责难理由。

examples.en: The report listed several preaccusations but avoided naming any individual.
examples.zh: 报告列出了一些早期指控依据，但避免点名任何个人。

examples.en: Journalists should distinguish between preaccusations and proven facts.
examples.zh: 记者应区分早期指控依据与已证实的事实。

extraExplanation: “preaccusation”不是非常常见的标准词，更常见的写法是带连字符的“pre-accusation”，或用更自然的表达如“before the accusation / pre-charge stage / pre-indictment stage（在起诉/起诉书之前）”。
该词多出现在法律、纪律调查、职场合规等语境中。使用时要注意语气：它常暗示“尚未定案”，适合与“allegation（指称）”“investigation（调查）”“due process（正当程序）”等词搭配，以避免把“怀疑”说成“事实”。

summary.en: Preaccuse means to accuse someone beforehand or prematurely.
summary.zh: preaccuse 指“预先/过早地指控某人”。

definition.en: to accuse someone in advance; to charge someone with wrongdoing before the person has a chance to act or before all facts are known
definition.zh: 预先指控；在事情尚未明朗或对方尚未行动前就先行 обвин/指责（某人）

examples.en: The article preaccused the coach of cheating before the investigation finished.
examples.zh: 调查尚未结束，那篇文章就先行指控教练作弊。

examples.en: Try not to preaccuse people online—wait for evidence.
examples.zh: 尽量不要在网上先入为主地指控别人——先等证据。

extraExplanation: “preaccuse”由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ accuse（“指控”）构成，但在现代英语中非常少见，很多情况下更常用的表达是：prejudge（先入为主地评判）、make accusations prematurely（过早指控）、accuse without evidence（无证据指控）。
语气与用法提示：它常带批评意味，暗示“未审先判/急于定罪”。在正式写作里，用更常见的替代表达通常更自然。

summary.en: Preaccused means “already accused” or “accused in advance,” but it’s rare; people usually say “previously/already accused.”
summary.zh: preaccused 指“先前已被指控的/预先被指控的”，但很少用；更常用 previously/already accused。

definition.en: (rare) accused in advance, or already accused before a later event (such as a trial, investigation, or public discussion).
definition.zh: （罕用）预先被指控的；在后续事件（如审判、调查或公开讨论）之前就已被指控的。

examples.en: The lawyer argued that the jury had been influenced by news stories about the preaccused suspect.
examples.zh: 律师辩称，陪审团受到了有关“先前已被指控的”嫌疑人的新闻报道影响。

examples.en: In the report, the preaccused employee was treated as guilty before any evidence was reviewed.
examples.zh: 在这份报告中，这名“预先被指控的”员工在证据审查前就被当作有罪。

extraExplanation: “preaccused”不是常见标准词，更常见的表达是“previously accused / already accused / pretrial accused（审前被告）”。在法律或新闻语境里，为避免“先入为主”的偏见，英语通常会用更明确、规范的说法。
构词上是前缀 pre-（在……之前）+ accused（被指控的）。如果你想表达“未审先判/先被贴标签”，也可用“presumed guilty（被预设为有罪）”。

summary.en: “Preaccusing” means accusing someone in advance, before you have clear evidence.
summary.zh: “preaccusing”指在没有明确证据前就先行指控别人。

definition.en: accusing someone in advance (before you have clear evidence), often based on assumptions
definition.zh: 在没有明确证据之前就先行指控（先入为主地认为对方有错）

examples.en: Preaccusing your teammate will only make cooperation harder.
examples.zh: 先行指控你的队友只会让合作更困难。

examples.en: The discussion turned tense because of preaccusing comments.
examples.zh: 因为一些先行指控的言论，讨论变得紧张。

definition.en: the act of accusing someone in advance; making an accusation before confirming facts
definition.zh: 先行指控的行为；在确认事实之前就提出指控

examples.en: Preaccusing can damage trust in a relationship.
examples.zh: 先行指控会破坏关系中的信任。

examples.en: Try asking questions instead of preaccusing.
examples.zh: 尽量先提问，而不是先行指控。

extraExplanation: “preaccusing”并不是非常常见的标准词，更常见的写法是带连字符的“pre-accusing”，或用更自然的表达：**preemptively accuse**（先发制人地指控）、**jump to conclusions**（妄下结论）、**make an accusation without evidence**（无证据指控）。
构词上：**pre-** 表示“在……之前”，**accuse** 表示“指控”。因此它强调“还没弄清事实就先怪罪/指控”。在正式写作中，建议用更常见的替代表达以避免读者觉得生硬。

summary.en: Preaccustom means to make someone familiar with something ahead of time (a rare, formal word).
summary.zh: preaccustom 指“使某人事先习惯/预先熟悉”（较罕见、偏正式用词）。

definition.en: to accustom someone (or yourself) to something in advance; to make someone familiar with something beforehand
definition.zh: 使（某人/自己）事先习惯；预先使熟悉

examples.en: The coach tried to preaccustom the new players to the team’s strict schedule before the season began.
examples.zh: 教练试图在赛季开始前让新队员事先习惯球队严格的日程。

examples.en: Reading short articles daily can preaccustom you to longer academic texts.
examples.zh: 每天读一些短文可以让你预先适应更长的学术文章。

definition.en: to become accustomed beforehand (rare)
definition.zh: （罕见）事先变得习惯；预先适应

examples.en: By practicing in a quiet room, she preaccustomed to the test format before exam day.
examples.zh: 通过在安静的房间练习，她在考试日之前就预先适应了题型。

extraExplanation: “preaccustom”非常少见，带有较强的书面/古旧色彩。现代英语里更常用“accustom someone to… / get used to… / familiarize someone with… / prepare someone for…”。
构词：pre-（在……之前）+ accustom（使习惯）。含义强调“提前建立习惯/熟悉感”。
用法提示：若写正式文本，通常会改写为“accustom … beforehand”或“prepare … in advance”，更自然。

summary.en: “Preaccustomed” means already used to something beforehand.
summary.zh: “preaccustomed”表示“在事前就已经习惯/适应了”。

definition.en: already accustomed to something in advance; made familiar with something before it happens
definition.zh: 预先习惯的；事先适应的（在某事发生前就已熟悉或习惯）

examples.en: New employees are preaccustomed to the company’s tools through online training.
examples.zh: 新员工通过线上培训，预先熟悉了公司的工具。

examples.en: If you’re preaccustomed to cold weather, winter travel feels easier.
examples.zh: 如果你事先习惯了寒冷天气，冬季出行会更轻松。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前”。“preaccustomed”由“pre- + accustomed”构成，语气偏正式，常见于说明某人/某群体在经历某事之前就已适应（如训练、环境、规则）。日常口语里更常说：“already used to… / already accustomed to…”。

summary.en: Preaccustoming means making someone used to something beforehand.
summary.zh: preaccustoming 指“提前让某人习惯某事”。

definition.en: getting someone used to something in advance; preparing a person or group so a later change feels normal
definition.zh: 事先让某人习惯某事；提前适应/铺垫，使之后的变化更容易接受

examples.en: The teacher began preaccustoming the class to longer readings by assigning short articles first.
examples.zh: 老师先布置短文章，逐步让全班提前习惯更长的阅读。

examples.en: The company’s pilot program was preaccustoming staff to the new schedule.
examples.zh: 公司的试点项目是在让员工提前适应新的排班。

extraExplanation: “preaccustoming”来自动词“preaccustom”（pre- + accustom），意思是“提前使……习惯”。它在现代英语中非常少见，写作里更常用更自然的表达：“preparing someone for…（让某人为……做准备）”、“gradually introducing…（逐步引入）”、“helping someone get used to…（帮助某人适应）”。
搭配提示：常见结构是“preaccustoming someone to + 名词/动名词”，例如“preaccustoming children to sharing（让孩子提前习惯分享）”。

summary.en: “Preaccustom(s)” means to make someone get used to something beforehand.
summary.zh: “preaccustom(s)”意为“使（某人）事先习惯于/预先熟悉”。

definition.en: to get someone used to something in advance; to familiarize beforehand
definition.zh: 使（某人）事先习惯于；预先使熟悉

examples.en: The program preaccustoms new employees to the company’s routines before their first day.
examples.zh: 该项目在新员工第一天上班前就让他们预先熟悉公司的日常流程。

examples.en: Training sessions can preaccustom students to the pace of a college class.
examples.zh: 培训课程可以让学生提前适应大学课堂的节奏。

definition.en: (less common) to become used to something beforehand
definition.zh: （较少见）事先适应；提前习惯

examples.en: After a few practice runs, she preaccustomed herself to the new schedule.
examples.zh: 经过几次试运行后，她提前适应了新的作息安排。

extraExplanation: “preaccustom”由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ accustom（“使习惯”）构成，整体意思就是“提前让……习惯”。它在现代英语中比较少见，日常更常用的表达是 “prepare someone for … / familiarize someone with … / get used to … in advance”。
你输入的 “preaccustoms” 通常是动词第三人称单数（He/She/It preaccustoms …），也可能被当作名词误写；如果你想表达名词意义，常用 “preparation（准备）/ familiarization（熟悉过程）”。

summary.en: Peace means “no war or violence” and also “a calm, worry-free feeling.”
summary.zh: peace 指“和平、无战争”，也指“内心的平静与安心”。

definition.en: a state of calm with no war, fighting, or violence; harmony and safety
definition.zh: 和平；没有战争、冲突或暴力的状态；安宁与和谐

examples.en: The two countries signed an agreement to bring peace to the region.
examples.zh: 两国签署协议，为该地区带来和平。

examples.en: Everyone hopes to live in peace.
examples.zh: 人人都希望生活在和平之中。

definition.en: a quiet, relaxed feeling with no worry or stress; inner calm
definition.zh: 内心的平静；无忧无虑的安宁感

examples.en: Meditation helps me find peace of mind.
examples.zh: 冥想帮助我获得内心的平静。

examples.en: She finally felt peace after talking with her friend.
examples.zh: 和朋友谈过之后，她终于感到安心。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“preace”很可能是拼写错误。最常见的正确拼写是“peace”（和平/安宁），读音 /pis/。
常见搭配：peace and quiet（清静/安静）、peace of mind（安心）、make peace (with sb.)（与某人和解）。
文化用法：有时人们会用“Peace!”作为道别或表达友好（较口语、带一点嬉皮/随和风格）。也常见短语“peace out”（口语：先走啦）。

summary.en: A medical term meaning “in front of the hip socket (acetabulum).”
summary.zh: 医学术语，表示“位于髋臼（髋关节窝）前方/髋臼前部的”。

definition.en: Located in front of (anterior to) the acetabulum, the hip socket.
definition.zh: 位于髋臼（髋关节的“关节窝”）前方的；髋臼前部的。

examples.en: The surgeon placed the incision in a preacetabular area to improve access to the hip joint.
examples.zh: 外科医生将切口放在髋臼前方区域，以便更好地进入髋关节。

examples.en: CT images showed a small preacetabular fracture near the rim of the socket.
examples.zh: CT 影像显示髋臼边缘附近有一处小的髋臼前部骨折。

extraExplanation: 这是一个医学/解剖学形容词，由前缀 pre-（“在……之前/在……前方”）+ acetabular（“髋臼的”）构成；在解剖方位里通常指“前方（anterior）”，而不是时间上的“之前”。
常见于骨科、影像学报告和手术记录，用来描述骨折、病灶、切口或解剖结构与髋臼的相对位置。也会看到近义表达：anterior acetabular（髋臼前部的）。
相关词：acetabulum（髋臼），acetabular（髋臼的），postacetabular（髋臼后方的/髋臼后部的），supraacetabular（髋臼上方的）。

summary.en: “Preach” can mean to deliver a religious sermon, to moralize or strongly advise (sometimes annoyingly), or informally to shout strong agreement: “Preach!”
summary.zh: “preach”可指宗教上的“布道/讲道”，也可指带点贬义的“说教/劝诫”，口语里还可用作感叹词表示强烈赞同：“太对了！”

definition.en: to give a religious talk or sermon; to speak publicly about God or faith
definition.zh: （宗教）布道；讲道；公开宣讲信仰

examples.en: The pastor preaches every Sunday morning.
examples.zh: 牧师每个周日早上都会讲道。

examples.en: She traveled to remote villages to preach.
examples.zh: 她去偏远村庄传道。

definition.en: to strongly advise or teach others about what is right or how to behave (often in a moralizing or annoying way)
definition.zh: （常带贬义）说教；劝诫别人该怎么做、什么是对的

examples.en: I don’t need you to preach to me about healthy eating.
examples.zh: 我不需要你对我说教健康饮食。

examples.en: He’s always preaching about hard work and discipline.
examples.zh: 他总是在宣讲努力和自律的重要。

definition.en: an enthusiastic way to show strong agreement, meaning “Exactly!” or “You’re so right!” (informal)
definition.zh: （口语）强烈赞同：相当于“没错！”“说得太对了！”

examples.en: “We all deserve respect.” “Preach!”
examples.zh: “我们都值得被尊重。” “太对了！”

extraExplanation: “Preach”在日常对话里如果用作动词（尤其对朋友说“You’re preaching”或“Don’t preach”），常带有“你别说教/别上纲上线”的语气；但用作感叹词“Preach!”则是很正面的支持与共鸣，常见于演讲、社交媒体评论区。
相关名词是“preacher”（传道人/布道者）和“preaching”（讲道；说教）。

summary.en: “Preachable” means suitable for preaching or able to be used in a sermon, often because it has a clear moral lesson.
summary.zh: “preachable”表示“适合用于讲道/布道的”，常因其包含清晰的道德寓意。

definition.en: able to be preached; suitable for preaching or for use in a sermon (often about a moral lesson).
definition.zh: 可用于布道的；适合用来讲道或在讲道中传达（通常指道德教训）。

examples.en: The pastor chose a preachable story with a clear lesson about forgiveness.
examples.zh: 牧师选了一个很适合讲道的故事，里面有关于宽恕的明确教训。

examples.en: Some Bible passages are more preachable than others because they are easier to apply to daily life.
examples.zh: 有些《圣经》段落比其他段落更适合讲道，因为更容易联系到日常生活。

extraExplanation: “preachable”在日常口语中不算常见，更多见于宗教/教会语境（如讲道、牧师培训、讲章写作）。
容易和“preachy（说教的、爱教训人的）”混淆：preachy通常带负面评价（让人觉得被教育/被道德绑架），而preachable一般是中性，强调“适合拿来讲道”。

summary.en: “Preached” is the past form of “preach”: it can mean giving a religious sermon or (more generally) strongly promoting an idea, sometimes in a preachy/moralizing way.
summary.zh: “preached”是“preach”的过去式/过去分词：可指宗教“布道”，也可泛指强烈宣扬某种观点，有时带“说教”意味。

definition.en: Past tense and past participle of “preach”: to give a religious talk (a sermon) in public, especially in a church.
definition.zh: “preach”的过去式和过去分词：进行宗教宣讲（布道），尤指在教堂里发表布道。

examples.en: The pastor preached about forgiveness on Sunday.
examples.zh: 牧师在周日讲道，主题是宽恕。

examples.en: She preached at a small church in the countryside.
examples.zh: 她在乡村的一座小教堂里布道。

definition.en: Past tense and past participle of “preach”: to strongly advise or promote an idea, often in a moralizing way.
definition.zh: “preach”的过去式和过去分词：强烈劝导或宣扬某种观点，常带有说教意味。

examples.en: He preached healthy eating, but he rarely cooked at home.
examples.zh: 他总爱宣扬健康饮食，但却很少在家做饭。

examples.en: I don’t mind advice, but I hate being preached at.
examples.zh: 我不介意别人提建议，但我讨厌被人说教。

extraExplanation: “preach”既可中性表示“布道/宣讲”，也可带一点负面语气，表示“说教”。常见搭配：preach about（就……宣讲/唠叨）、preach to someone（对某人布道/说教）、preach at someone（更强调让人反感的“对着某人说教”）。
常见相关表达：preach to the choir（对本来就同意的人强调同样观点；中文可理解为“对认同者再讲一遍/多此一举”）。

summary.en: A preacher is someone who delivers sermons in a religious setting, or more generally someone who strongly promotes an idea or lifestyle.
summary.zh: preacher 指在宗教场合讲道的人；也可泛指大力宣扬某种观点或生活方式的人。

definition.en: A person (often a minister or pastor) who gives religious talks or sermons, especially in a church.
definition.zh: （常指牧师或传道人）在宗教场合讲道、布道的人，尤指在教堂里讲道的人。

examples.en: The preacher spoke about forgiveness during Sunday service.
examples.zh: 这位传道人在周日礼拜中讲了关于宽恕的主题。

examples.en: She listened carefully to the preacher’s sermon.
examples.zh: 她认真地听这位讲道者的布道。

definition.en: A person who strongly promotes a belief, idea, or way of life (not necessarily religious).
definition.zh: （不一定宗教）大力宣扬某种信念、观点或生活方式的人。

examples.en: He’s a preacher of healthy living—no smoking, no junk food.
examples.zh: 他是健康生活的倡导者——不抽烟、不吃垃圾食品。

examples.en: She became a preacher for teamwork in the company.
examples.zh: 她在公司里成了团队合作的积极倡导者。

extraExplanation: 在英语文化中，preacher 常带有“面向听众公开讲话、劝导或劝诫”的感觉。用于非宗教语境时，有时会带一点点评价意味：如果别人觉得你“说教”，可能会用 preach（动词）或说 someone is preaching，暗示你在讲大道理。与 pastor（牧师，教会职务更明确）相比，preacher 更强调“讲道/宣讲”的角色。

summary.en: Preacherdom means the collective world or profession of preachers.
summary.zh: preacherdom 指传道人（牧师等）的整体群体或职业圈，即“传道界”。

definition.en: The group, profession, or “world” of preachers (people whose job is preaching), especially considered as a whole.
definition.zh: 传道人（牧师等）的群体、职业圈或“传道界”；强调作为整体来看。

examples.en: In that town, preacherdom had a strong influence on public life.
examples.zh: 在那个小镇，传道界对公共生活有很强的影响。

examples.en: He was respected in preacherdom for his calm, practical sermons.
examples.zh: 他因冷静务实的讲道而在传道界备受尊重。

extraExplanation: “preacherdom”由 preacher（传道人）+ 后缀 -dom 构成。-dom 常表示“……的领域/群体/状态”，类似的词有 kingdom（王国）、freedom（自由）、officialdom（官僚系统/官场）。因此 preacherdom 更像在说“传道人这一圈子/行业生态”，语气有时略带评论意味。
该词不算常用，更常见的表达是 “the clergy”（神职人员）、“the ministry”（牧职/教会事工）、或直接说 “preachers as a group”（传道人群体）。

summary.en: A (now uncommon) word meaning “female preacher.”
summary.zh: 一个（如今较少用的）词，意思是“女传道人/女布道者”。

definition.en: A woman who preaches, especially one who gives religious sermons or speaks publicly about faith (a feminine form of “preacher,” now less common).
definition.zh: 女传道人；女布道者（“preacher”的女性形式，如今较少使用）。

examples.en: In the novel, the preacheress travels from town to town to deliver sermons.
examples.zh: 在小说里，这位女布道者走遍各城镇讲道。

examples.en: The community respected her as a preacheress known for powerful speeches.
examples.zh: 社区很敬重她，认为她是一位以演讲有力著称的女传道人。

extraExplanation: “preacheress”由 preacher + 女性后缀 -ess 构成，和 actress、waitress 类似。现代英语更常用不标性别的 preacher，尤其在正式场合；preacheress 可能带有旧式或刻意强调性别的语感。
在历史或文学语境（例如描写19世纪的宗教复兴运动、巡回布道）中更常见；在当代写作中使用时，注意是否会让读者感觉“刻意区分男女”。

summary.en: “Preacherize” means to talk like a preacher, often in a moralizing or lecturing way.
summary.zh: “preacherize”指像传道人一样讲话，常带有说教、讲大道理的意味。

definition.en: to speak or write like a preacher; to deliver a moralizing or sermon-like talk
definition.zh: 像传道人一样讲话或写作；用说教/布道式的口吻发表意见

examples.en: He started to preacherize about honesty after the meeting.
examples.zh: 会后他开始用说教的口吻谈论诚实。

examples.en: I didn’t come here to be preacherized—I just wanted advice.
examples.zh: 我不是来听你说教的——我只是想要建议。

extraExplanation: “preacherize”比较少见，常带有一点贬义或不耐烦的语气，暗示对方在“说教、讲大道理”。
词尾“-ize”常表示“使……化/以……方式做某事”，所以 preacher + -ize ≈ “用传道人的方式讲话”。正式写作里更常用 moralize、preach at (someone)。

summary.en: “Preacherless” means having no preacher.
summary.zh: “preacherless”指“没有传道人/牧师的”。

definition.en: Without a preacher; not having someone who regularly preaches or leads religious services.
definition.zh: 没有传道人（牧师/讲道者）的；缺少固定讲道或主持宗教礼拜之人的。

examples.en: The small, preacherless church relied on visiting pastors once a month.
examples.zh: 这间小教堂没有固定传道人，只能每月靠外来的牧师来主持一次。

examples.en: In a preacherless community, neighbors often take turns leading prayers and hymns.
examples.zh: 在没有传道人的社区里，邻里常常轮流带领祷告和唱圣诗。

extraExplanation: “preacherless”不是非常常见的日常词，更常见的说法是“without a preacher”或“having no pastor/minister”。
构词：preacher（传道人/讲道者）+ -less（“没有……”）。与之类似的词有“leaderless（无领导的）”“homeless（无家可归的）”。

summary.en: An informal, often slightly mocking word for a minor or inexperienced preacher, or someone who likes to preach.
summary.zh: 非正式且常带讽刺：指小角色/不成熟的传道人，或爱说教的人。

definition.en: A (usually informal or slightly mocking) term for a small-time, inexperienced, or self-important preacher; someone who preaches in an affected or minor way.
definition.zh: （多为非正式、略带嘲讽）小角色/不成熟的传道人；爱说教却分量不大的人。

examples.en: He acted like a preacherling, lecturing everyone about manners.
examples.zh: 他像个“preacherling”一样，对每个人的礼貌问题指指点点。

examples.en: The town had its share of preacherlings who loved to hear themselves talk.
examples.zh: 镇上也不乏这类“preacherling”，就爱听自己滔滔不绝。

extraExplanation: “preacherling”不是常见词，更像是作者临时造词（nonce word），由 preacher（传道人）+ 后缀 -ling 构成。
后缀 “-ling” 常带“小、次要、年轻/不成熟”的意味，有时也带轻微贬义或戏谑（如 underling、hireling）。因此 preacherling 往往暗示“地位不高/经验不足/爱摆架子”。
使用场景通常偏文学或讽刺语气；正式写作更常用 minor preacher、would-be preacher、self-styled preacher 等。

summary.en: “Preachers” means people who give religious sermons; it can also mean people who strongly promote an idea (sometimes in a preachy, critical way).
summary.zh: “preachers”指“传道人/讲道者”的复数；也可指“鼓吹者/爱说教的人”（有时带批评意味）。

definition.en: A person who gives religious talks (sermons), often in a church, to teach or encourage people based on the Bible or other sacred texts.
definition.zh: 传道人；讲道者（在教堂等场合发表宗教讲道、讲解圣经或其他经典来教导与劝勉人）。

examples.en: The preacher spoke about forgiveness and kindness.
examples.zh: 传道人讲了宽恕与善良。

examples.en: Many people came to hear the preacher on Sunday morning.
examples.zh: 很多人周日早晨来听传道人讲道。

definition.en: Someone who strongly promotes a moral or political idea (sometimes used critically, as if they talk too much about what others ‘should’ do).
definition.zh: （有时带批评意味）鼓吹者；说教者（强烈宣扬某种道德或政治主张，常给人“爱说教”的感觉）。

examples.en: He’s a preacher for healthy living, always telling people to exercise.
examples.zh: 他是健康生活的“鼓吹者”，总是叫大家去运动。

examples.en: She doesn’t like being called a preacher because it sounds judgmental.
examples.zh: 她不喜欢被叫作“说教者”，因为听起来很爱评判人。

extraExplanation: “preachers”是复数形式；单数是“preacher”。常见搭配：street preacher（街头传道者）、guest preacher（客座讲员）、lay preacher（平信徒讲员）。
在英语文化里，“preacher”既可以是中性/尊称（指宗教讲道者），也可能带一点负面语气（指爱说教的人）。语气取决于上下文。
文学与常见用法提示：在美国英语中，“preacher”也常用来指新教教会的牧师或布道者（不一定是正式职称），在乡村或南方语境里尤其常见。

summary.en: “Preachership” means the office or role of a preacher.
summary.zh: “preachership”指传道者/牧师的职位或职务。

definition.en: the position, role, or office of a preacher (the job or responsibility of preaching).
definition.zh: 传道者/牧师的职位或职务；讲道的职责。

examples.en: He accepted the preachership at a small rural church.
examples.zh: 他接受了一个乡村小教会的传道职位。

examples.en: The preachership requires strong communication skills and deep empathy.
examples.zh: 传道职务需要很强的沟通能力和深切的同理心。

extraExplanation: “preachership”较少见，更多时候人们会说“pastorate / ministry / preaching position”。它是由“preacher（传道者）+ -ship（表示身份、职位或状态）”构成的名词，类似于“leadership（领导职位/领导力）”。
在宗教语境中，这个词多见于较正式或教会内部的写作，用来强调“职位/任命”本身，而不是“讲道行为”。

summary.en: “Preaches” means “gives a sermon,” or more generally “strongly teaches/advises or promotes an idea,” often with a moral or ‘preachy’ tone.
summary.zh: “Preaches”表示“讲道”，也可泛指“（带说教意味地）劝导/宣讲”或“宣扬某种理念”。

definition.en: (of a priest, minister, or religious leader) to give a sermon; to speak about religious teachings in public.
definition.zh: （牧师、神父等宗教领袖）讲道；公开宣讲宗教教义。

examples.en: She preaches every Sunday at the local church.
examples.zh: 她每个星期天都在当地教堂讲道。

examples.en: The pastor preaches about kindness and forgiveness.
examples.zh: 牧师讲的是善良与宽恕。

definition.en: to strongly advise or teach what you believe is morally right, sometimes in a way that sounds like you think you’re better than others.
definition.zh: （常带说教意味地）强烈劝导/宣讲你认为正确的道德观；有时给人高高在上的感觉。

examples.en: He always preaches about healthy living, but he never exercises.
examples.zh: 他总爱说教健康生活，但自己从不锻炼。

examples.en: I don’t need you to preach to me—I know I was wrong.
examples.zh: 我不需要你对我说教——我知道我错了。

definition.en: to publicly promote an idea, attitude, or way of life.
definition.zh: 公开宣扬（某种理念、态度或生活方式）。

examples.en: The campaign preaches equality and respect.
examples.zh: 这场活动宣扬平等与尊重。

examples.en: She preaches the value of lifelong learning.
examples.zh: 她宣扬终身学习的重要性。

extraExplanation: “preaches”是动词“preach”的一般现在时第三人称单数形式（he/she/it preaches）。
常见习语：preach to the choir（也写作 preach to the converted），意思是“对本来就同意的人说教/宣传”，强调对象已经被说服了。

summary.en: “Preachier” means “more preachy,” usually describing a tone that gives moral lessons or tells others what they should do, often annoyingly.
summary.zh: “preachier”表示“更说教的”，常指语气像在训人或灌输道理，通常带负面色彩。

definition.en: More preachy: sounding like someone is giving moral lessons or telling others how they should behave (often in an annoying or self-righteous way).
definition.zh: 更说教的；更爱讲道理/训人的（常带有令人反感的、自以为是的语气）。

examples.en: The sequel is preachier than the first movie, with long speeches about what people should do.
examples.zh: 这部续集比第一部电影更说教，加入了很多关于人们“应该怎么做”的长篇演讲。

examples.en: I agree with her message, but her tone gets preachier when she’s angry.
examples.zh: 我同意她表达的观点，但她一生气语气就更说教了。

examples.en: Can you say it without sounding preachier? I’m trying to listen.
examples.zh: 你能不能别那么说教地讲？我在努力听。

extraExplanation: “preachier”是形容词“preachy（说教的）”的比较级，常用于对比两种表达方式：preachy → preachier → preachiest。
它通常带负面评价，强调“像在布道/训话”，让人觉得被指责或被教训；如果想更中性，可以用“more moralistic（更道德说教）”“more didactic（更教导性的）”，或用委婉说法如“a bit too instructive（有点太爱指导）”。
相关词：preach（v. 布道/宣讲）、preacher（n. 传教士/布道者）。在影评、书评或社交讨论中很常见，用来批评作品或发言“讲道理多、故事/事实少”。

summary.en: “Preachiest” means “the most preachy”—the most moralizing or lecturing in an annoying, self-righteous way.
summary.zh: “preachiest”表示“最说教的”——最爱讲大道理、训人、带自以为是语气的。

definition.en: (Superlative of preachy) Most likely to sound like you are giving moral advice or telling others how they should behave, often in an annoying or self-righteous way.
definition.zh: （preachy 的最高级）最爱说教的；最像在讲道理、教训别人该怎么做的（常带烦人或自以为是的语气）。

examples.en: Of all the comments, his was the preachiest and least helpful.
examples.zh: 在所有评论里，他那条最爱说教，也最没帮助。

examples.en: That film’s preachiest moments feel more like a lecture than a story.
examples.zh: 那部电影最说教的片段更像上课讲课，而不是在讲故事。

extraExplanation: “preachy”通常带贬义，强调语气像“传道/讲大道理”，而不是单纯“给建议”。“preachiest”是最高级，用来比较“谁最说教”。
常见搭配：preachiest tone / preachiest message / preachiest part (of a speech, movie, article)。更中性可用：moral, instructive；更尖锐可用：self-righteous（自以为正义/清高）。

summary.en: “Preachieved” is a rare word meaning “already achieved” or “achieved ahead of time.”
summary.zh: “preachieved”较罕见，意思是“已经达成的/提前实现的”。

definition.en: (rare) achieved or attained in advance; already achieved before a later point in time.
definition.zh: （罕见）预先达成的；在之后某个时间点之前就已经实现的。

examples.en: The team used the preachieved results from last year as a baseline for the new experiment.
examples.zh: 团队把去年已预先取得的结果作为新实验的基线。

examples.en: We shouldn’t celebrate goals that are only preachieved on paper.
examples.zh: 我们不该为只是在文件上“预先达成”的目标而庆祝。

definition.en: the past form of a rare verb “preachieve”: to achieve something ahead of time.
definition.zh: “preachieve”（罕见动词）的过去式：提前实现某事。

examples.en: By automating the routine steps, we preachieved most of the milestones before the deadline.
examples.zh: 通过自动化常规步骤，我们在截止日期前就提前完成了大部分里程碑。

extraExplanation: “preachieved”不是常用词，更常见的表达是“already achieved / previously achieved / achieved in advance”。在正式写作中，用这些更自然、读者更容易理解。
构词上可理解为前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ achieve（“达成”）+ -ed（过去分词/形容词）。但因为英语里“pre- + achieve”不算固定搭配，所以会显得生硬或学术腔。

summary.en: Preachification means turning speech or writing into a sermon-like, overly preachy lecture.
summary.zh: preachification 指把讲话或文字变成像布道一样、过度说教的内容。

definition.en: (Humorous, informal) The act of turning something into a sermon-like talk; excessive moralizing or lecturing in a “preachy” way.
definition.zh: （幽默、非正式）把某事变成像布道一样的讲话；过度说教、爱讲大道理。

examples.en: I liked the documentary, but the preachification in the last ten minutes felt unnecessary.
examples.zh: 我喜欢这部纪录片，但最后十分钟的说教感有点多余。

examples.en: Her advice was helpful until it slipped into preachification.
examples.zh: 她的建议一开始很有帮助，但后来就变成了说教。

examples.en: The coach tried to motivate us, not drown us in preachification.
examples.zh: 教练想激励我们，而不是用一堆说教把我们淹没。

extraExplanation: 这个词比较少见，常带一点调侃意味。它由 preach（布道/说教）+ -ification（“使……化/……化的过程”）构成，表达“把内容变得很‘像布道’”。日常更常用的说法是 preachiness（说教味）或 moralizing（道德说教）。

summary.en: Preachified means made preachy—turned into something that sounds overly moralizing or sermon-like.
summary.zh: preachified 指“变得很说教”，带有过度道德化、像布道一样的语气。

definition.en: (Informal) Made overly moralizing or sermon-like; turned into something that sounds like a preacher is talking.
definition.zh: （非正式）变得说教的、爱讲大道理的；被“讲成一篇布道/道德说教”的感觉。

examples.en: The movie started as a fun comedy, but the ending felt preachified.
examples.zh: 这部电影一开始很好笑，但结尾感觉变得很说教。

examples.en: I like his ideas, but his speech was a bit preachified for the audience.
examples.zh: 我喜欢他的观点，但他的演讲对观众来说有点太说教了。

examples.en: She rewrote the paragraph so it wouldn’t sound preachified.
examples.zh: 她把那段改写了一下，让它听起来不那么说教。

extraExplanation: “preachified”不是很正式的词，更常见的是用“preachy”（说教的）或“moralizing”（道德说教的）。
构词上来自“preach（布道/说教）+ -ify（使变成）+ -ed”，强调“被加工成说教口吻”的结果。
常带轻微负面语气：不是单纯“有道理”，而是让人感觉被教育、被灌输。

summary.en: “Preachify” means to make something sound preachy or moralizing, often in a negative sense.
summary.zh: “preachify”指把话说得很说教、道德化，通常带贬义。

definition.en: (informal, often critical) To make something sound like a sermon; to make it overly moralizing or “preachy.”
definition.zh: （非正式，常带批评）把某事说得像布道一样；使其变得说教、爱讲大道理。

examples.en: The documentary starts strong, but the ending preachifies the message and feels judgmental.
examples.zh: 这部纪录片开头很有力，但结尾把信息讲得太说教，显得在评判别人。

examples.en: Try not to preachify your advice—people listen better when you sound respectful.
examples.zh: 给建议时尽量别太说教——语气尊重一点，别人更愿意听。

definition.en: To turn a topic or conversation into moral instruction rather than discussion.
definition.zh: 把话题或对话变成道德训导，而不是平等讨论。

examples.en: We were talking about diet, and he suddenly preachified the whole conversation.
examples.zh: 我们本来在聊饮食，他却突然把整段对话变成了道德说教。

examples.en: When discussions preachify, some people shut down and stop sharing.
examples.zh: 当讨论开始变成说教时，有些人就会关闭自己，不再分享。

extraExplanation: “preachify”多见于口语、网络或创意写作中，不算常规词典里的标准用词。它由 preach（布道/说教）+ -ify（使成为……）构成，语气通常带一点吐槽或不满。

summary.en: “Preachifying” means speaking or writing in a preachy, moralizing, sermon-like way (informal).
summary.zh: “preachifying”指用一种说教、道德训诫、像布道一样的方式说话或写作（非正式）。

definition.en: (informal) The act of making something sound preachy, moralizing, or like a sermon; to speak or write in a way that feels like you’re lecturing others about what’s right.
definition.zh: （非正式）把话说得像布道或说教一样；以一种让人觉得在讲道理、训人、强调道德对错的方式说话或写作。

examples.en: The message was fine, but the preachifying turned some readers off.
examples.zh: 信息本身没问题，但那种说教的语气让一些读者反感。

examples.en: Try explaining your point without preachifying—use facts and examples instead.
examples.zh: 试着别用说教的方式来表达观点——改用事实和例子。

examples.en: He started preachifying about “responsibility,” and everyone went quiet.
examples.zh: 他开始说教“责任”这套话题，大家都安静了。

extraExplanation: “preachifying”来自动词“preachify”（preach + -ify），带有口语、带点调侃的感觉，常用于批评某人讲话“太爱讲道理/太正经说教”。
和“preaching”相比，“preachifying”更强调“把普通表达刻意弄成说教风”，语气上更负面、更像吐槽。

summary.en: “Preachily” means speaking or writing in an overly moralizing, preachy way.
summary.zh: “preachily”指以过度说教、道德训诫式的方式说话或写作。

definition.en: In a way that sounds too moralizing, lecturing, or like you’re telling others how to behave (often in an annoying or self-righteous tone).
definition.zh: 以（令人反感的）说教式口吻；带有道德训诫、居高临下地教训他人的方式。

examples.en: He spoke preachily about healthy living, even though he never exercises.
examples.zh: 他用说教的口气谈健康生活，但他自己从不锻炼。

examples.en: The article preachily tells readers what they ‘should’ do instead of offering practical advice.
examples.zh: 这篇文章用说教的方式告诉读者“应该”怎么做，而不是提供实用建议。

extraExplanation: “preachily”来自形容词“preachy（爱说教的）”。它通常带负面评价，暗示对方不只是表达观点，而是在“像牧师讲道一样”对别人进行道德评判或训斥。日常写作中更常见的表达是“in a preachy way / preachily”。

summary.en: “Preachiness” means an annoyingly moralizing, preachy tone or attitude.
summary.zh: “preachiness”指（令人反感的）说教口吻或说教态度。

definition.en: The quality of sounding like you are giving a moral lecture—especially in an annoying or self-righteous way.
definition.zh: （说话或写作的）说教味；爱摆道理的口吻（常含“令人反感、带优越感”的贬义）

examples.en: Some readers disliked the preachiness of the novel, even though they agreed with its message.
examples.zh: 有些读者不喜欢这本小说的说教味，尽管他们认同它传达的观点。

examples.en: The campaign video had a lot of preachiness and not enough practical advice.
examples.zh: 这支宣传视频说教成分太多，实用建议却不够。

definition.en: A preachy attitude or style in speech or writing; a tendency to tell others what they should do or believe.
definition.zh: 说教式的态度或文风；动辄教人“应该怎样”的倾向

examples.en: Try to share your opinion without preachiness—people listen more when they don’t feel judged.
examples.zh: 尽量在表达观点时避免说教味——当人们不觉得被评判时，更愿意倾听。

examples.en: Her essays are thoughtful, but a touch of preachiness can turn some people away.
examples.zh: 她的文章很有思考，但一点点说教味就可能让部分读者退却。

extraExplanation: “preachiness”来自动词 preach（布道/说教）+ 名词后缀 -iness（表示“……的状态/特质”）。因此它常用来批评一种“道德高地式”的表达方式。
语气与搭配：常见说法有 the preachiness of… / a sense of preachiness。和 moralizing（道德说教）、self-righteousness（自以为是）常一起出现。

summary.en: “Preaching” can mean religious sermons, or (often critically) moralizing and telling others how to live.
summary.zh: “preaching”可指宗教讲道，也可（常带批评）指说教、用道德口吻教别人怎么做。

definition.en: the act of giving a sermon or religious talk, often to teach or encourage moral behavior
definition.zh: （宗教）讲道、布道；通过讲道来教导或劝勉人遵守道德

examples.en: The priest’s preaching focused on kindness and forgiveness.
examples.zh: 神父的讲道重点谈到了仁慈与宽恕。

examples.en: She grew up listening to preaching every Sunday.
examples.zh: 她从小每个星期天都听讲道。

definition.en: speaking seriously in a way that tells others how they should think or behave; moralizing (often used critically)
definition.zh: （常含批评）说教、训人；以道德优越的口吻告诉别人该怎么想或怎么做

examples.en: I’m tired of his preaching about healthy living.
examples.zh: 我受够了他对健康生活的说教。

examples.en: Instead of preaching, try listening to what they’re going through.
examples.zh: 别一味说教，先试着听听他们正在经历什么。

definition.en: the present participle of “preach”: giving a sermon or speaking publicly to teach religious or moral lessons
definition.zh: 动词“preach”的现在分词：讲道、布道；公开宣讲宗教或道德教训

examples.en: He is preaching at the church this evening.
examples.zh: 他今晚在教堂讲道。

examples.en: She’s always preaching about honesty in the workplace.
examples.zh: 她总是在职场上宣讲诚实的重要性。

extraExplanation: “preaching”既可以是名词（讲道/说教），也可以当作动词的现在分词（正在讲道/正在说教）。日常口语里，批评别人“preaching”常暗示：对方不只是分享建议，而是在以高姿态教训人。
文化语境中，“preaching to the choir”（对唱诗班布道）是常见习语，意思是“对本来就同意你的人反复强调”，相当于中文的“对牛弹琴”的反向版本（听众不是不懂，而是本来就赞同）。

summary.en: “Preachingly” means speaking or writing in a moralizing, lecturing way, like a preacher.
summary.zh: “preachingly”表示用带有道德训诫、说教式的口吻说话或写作，像在“讲道/教育别人”。

definition.en: In a way that sounds like giving a moral lecture; like a preacher.
definition.zh: 以说教的方式；像牧师讲道那样（带有道德训诫、居高临下的语气）。

examples.en: He spoke preachingly about honesty, but he didn’t always follow his own advice.
examples.zh: 他以说教的口吻谈论诚实，但他并不总是遵守自己的建议。

examples.en: The article is informative, but at times it feels preachingly judgmental.
examples.zh: 这篇文章信息量很大，但有时让人感觉带着说教式的评判。

extraExplanation: “preachingly”来自动词 preach（布道；宣讲），加上副词后缀 -ingly，表示“以……的方式”。它常用于批评语气：说话像在“教育别人/指点别人”一样，容易让人觉得被评判。
近义表达常用：in a preachy way / in a moralizing tone（以说教/道德评判的口吻）。更口语的形容词是 preachy（说教的）。

summary.en: “Preachings” means sermons or teachings (often religious), and it can also mean moralizing advice that feels judgmental.
summary.zh: “preachings”指（多为宗教的）讲道/教义讲论；也可指带评判意味的说教。

definition.en: (Plural) religious sermons or talks given by someone (especially a priest or pastor) to teach faith and guide behavior.
definition.zh: （复数）布道；讲道：由宗教人士（尤指牧师、神父）进行的宗教讲论，用来解释信仰并引导行为。

examples.en: The church is known for its thoughtful preachings on compassion.
examples.zh: 这座教堂以关于同情心的深思熟虑的讲道而闻名。

examples.en: Some people attend weekly just to listen to the preachings.
examples.zh: 有些人每周去参加礼拜只是为了听讲道。

definition.en: (Plural) moral teachings or advice—often used when someone talks in a way that feels judgmental or tries to control others’ choices.
definition.zh: （复数）说教；道德训诫（常带贬义）：指以评判或控制他人选择的口吻进行的道德劝告。

examples.en: I’m tired of his preachings about how everyone should live.
examples.zh: 我厌倦了他那套“人人都该怎样生活”的说教。

examples.en: Her preachings didn’t help; we needed practical solutions.
examples.zh: 她的说教并没有帮助；我们需要的是实际的解决办法。

extraExplanation: “preachings”是名词复数，单数常见为“preaching”（讲道/说教，既可中性也可贬义）或“a preaching”（较少见）。在日常英语里，表示“一场讲道”更常说“a sermon”。

summary.en: “Preachman” is an uncommon/old-fashioned word meaning a preacher (a man who preaches).
summary.zh: “preachman”是较少见/旧式用法，意思是“传道人、讲道者”（通常指男性）。

definition.en: (Uncommon) A preacher; a man who preaches, especially in a Christian church.
definition.zh: （不常用）传道人；讲道者（尤指基督教会中讲道的男性）。

examples.en: In the old town, the preachman spoke every Sunday at the small chapel.
examples.zh: 在那座老城里，那位传道人每个星期天都会在小礼拜堂讲道。

examples.en: Some older texts use “preachman” where we would now say “preacher.”
examples.zh: 一些较早的文本会用“preachman”，而现代英语通常说“preacher”。

extraExplanation: “preachman”在现代英语里很少见，更多是方言、旧式写法或在文学作品中为了营造年代感而使用。日常交流中更常用的词是“preacher”（传道人/牧师）或“minister”（牧师/神职人员）。
词形上它由“preach（讲道）+ man（男子）”构成，因此带有性别指向；现代写作中常倾向用更中性或更通行的表达。

summary.en: A (often annoying) moralizing talk or sermon; a piece of preachy advice.
summary.zh: （常令人反感的）说教式训话/布道；带训诫意味的长篇劝告。

definition.en: A long, moralizing talk or sermon meant to teach people how they should behave, often sounding too serious or judgmental.
definition.zh: （常带批评或说教意味的）长篇训诫/布道；一段教人该如何做人的讲话。

examples.en: I don’t need a preachment about responsibility—I already know I was late.
examples.zh: 我不需要你对“责任”来一段说教——我已经知道我迟到了。

examples.en: His speech turned into a preachment about family values.
examples.zh: 他的演讲后来变成了一段关于家庭价值观的说教。

extraExplanation: “preachment”在现代英语中不算常见，更常见的表达是“preaching”（说教/布道）或“sermon”（布道词/训话）。它通常带有负面语气，暗示对方在“居高临下地教训人”。
词源上与“preach”（布道、宣讲）有关；在文学或口语里用它，往往是为了强调“听起来像宗教式的训话”，不一定真的与宗教有关。

summary.en: “Preachments” means sermons, or (often critically) moralizing lectures.
summary.zh: “preachments”指讲道；也可（常带批评）指说教式的道德训诫。

definition.en: sermons; religious talks meant to teach or encourage faith
definition.zh: 布道；讲道（宗教性的讲演，用来教导或鼓励信仰）

examples.en: The village church held preachments every Sunday morning.
examples.zh: 村里的教堂每周日早上都会举行讲道。

examples.en: In his preachments, the pastor often spoke about kindness and responsibility.
examples.zh: 在他的讲道中，牧师常常谈到善良与责任。

definition.en: (often critical) moral lectures or advice that feels too instructive or judgmental
definition.zh: （常带批评意味）说教；道德训诫（让人觉得过于教训或评判）

examples.en: I wanted sympathy, not preachments about what I should have done.
examples.zh: 我想要的是安慰，而不是关于我“该怎么做”的说教。

examples.en: Her friends avoided giving preachments and simply listened.
examples.zh: 她的朋友们避免说教，只是认真倾听。

extraExplanation: “preachments”是名词复数，单数较少见（preachment）。现代英语里更常用“sermons”（讲道）或“preaching”（布道/说教）。
在文学或较旧的文体中更容易见到“preachments”，尤其用来强调“冗长、带训诫味”的讲话，因此有时带一点讽刺色彩。

summary.en: Preachy describes a moralizing, sermon-like way of speaking that often feels annoying or self-righteous.
summary.zh: Preachy 指带有说教、讲道式的表达方式，常让人觉得烦或自以为是。

definition.en: Speaking in a way that gives moral advice too strongly or too often, especially in an annoying or self-righteous way.
definition.zh: （尤指令人反感地）爱说教的；道德劝诫过多的；自以为是地教训人的。

examples.en: The movie had a powerful message, but it felt a bit preachy at times.
examples.zh: 这部电影主题很有力量，但有些时候显得有点说教。

examples.en: I agree with her, yet her tone comes across as preachy.
examples.zh: 我同意她的观点，但她的语气听起来有点说教。

examples.en: Try to share your opinion without sounding preachy.
examples.zh: 尽量表达你的看法，但别显得像在说教。

definition.en: Like a sermon or religious lecture in style (often formal or old-fashioned).
definition.zh: （风格上）像布道/讲道一样的；带有讲经式语气的（常较正式或略显老派）。

examples.en: His speech had a preachy rhythm, as if he were addressing a congregation.
examples.zh: 他的演讲节奏很像布道，仿佛在对会众讲话。

examples.en: The narrator’s preachy voice doesn’t fit the light comedy.
examples.zh: 叙述者那种布道式的口吻不适合轻松喜剧。

extraExplanation: “preachy”通常带负面评价，暗示对方不只是表达观点，而是以“我更正确/更道德”的姿态来劝人。
常见搭配：preachy tone（说教的语气）、a bit/kind of preachy（有点说教）、sound/come across as preachy（听起来显得说教）。
和“persuasive（有说服力的）/instructive（有教育意义的）”不同，“preachy”强调让人不舒服的说教感。

summary.en: Pre-acid (often written “pre-acid”) means a preliminary acid-related step or treatment done before the main acid process.
summary.zh: Pre-acid（常写作“pre-acid”）指在主要酸处理之前进行的预先酸相关步骤或处理。

definition.en: (technical) Done or added before an acid treatment or before something becomes acidic.
definition.zh: （技术用语）在酸处理之前进行的；在变酸之前添加/完成的。

examples.en: The engineers planned a pre-acid wash to prepare the surface for etching.
examples.zh: 工程师计划先进行预酸洗，以便为蚀刻做准备。

examples.en: In some processes, a pre-acid step helps remove residue before the main acid bath.
examples.zh: 在一些工艺中，预酸步骤有助于在主酸浴之前去除残留物。

definition.en: (technical) To treat with acid in advance; to apply acid as a preliminary step.
definition.zh: （技术用语）预先用酸处理；作为前置步骤施加酸。

examples.en: They pre-acided the metal to improve adhesion of the coating.
examples.zh: 他们先对金属进行了预酸处理，以提高涂层的附着力。

examples.en: The rock was pre-acided before the main stimulation stage.
examples.zh: 岩层在主要增产阶段之前进行了预酸处理。

extraExplanation: “preacid”更常见的写法是带连字符的“pre-acid”。它多出现在化学实验、材料表面处理、以及油气井酸化（acidizing）等行业语境中。日常英语里很少单独使用。
如果你是在阅读实验步骤或工程报告看到这个词，通常表示“主酸处理之前的准备性酸处理/预处理”。

summary.en: Preacidity means the acidity present before a later process or adjustment.
summary.zh: Preacidity 指在后续加工或调整之前就存在的酸度（预酸度/初始酸度）。

definition.en: the level or amount of acidity present before a later process, change, or treatment (often used in food science, brewing, winemaking, or chemistry).
definition.zh: （常用于食品科学、酿造、葡萄酒或化学）在后续处理、变化或工序之前就已存在的酸度水平/酸含量。

examples.en: The lab measured the juice’s preacidity before adjusting the pH.
examples.zh: 实验室在调整 pH 之前先测量了果汁的预酸度（preacidity）。

examples.en: High preacidity can affect fermentation speed and flavor.
examples.zh: 较高的预酸度可能会影响发酵速度和风味。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前”，因此 preacidity 直译为“（处理前的）酸度”。它不是日常英语高频词，更常见于技术/学术写作或检测报告中。
更口语或更常见的表达通常是 “initial acidity / starting acidity”（初始酸度）或直接说 “the acidity before treatment/processing”（处理前的酸度）。

summary.en: “Preacidly” is not a standard word; it is usually a misspelling of “precisely” (exactly, accurately).
summary.zh: “preacidly” 不是标准英语词；通常是把 “precisely”（确切地、精确地）拼错。

definition.en: (Nonstandard) Not an established English word; most often a misspelling of “precisely.”
definition.zh: （非标准）不是公认的英语单词；最常见是把 “precisely” 拼错。

examples.en: The essay wrote “preacidly,” but the intended word was “precisely.”
examples.zh: 文章里写了 “preacidly”，但想表达的应是 “precisely”。

examples.en: If you mean “exactly,” use “precisely,” not “preacidly.”
examples.zh: 如果你想表达“确切地/正是如此”，应使用 “precisely”，而不是 “preacidly”。

definition.en: If you meant “precisely”: exactly; in a way that is accurate and careful.
definition.zh: 如果你想写的是 “precisely”：确切地；精确地；严谨准确地。

examples.en: Please describe precisely what happened.
examples.zh: 请准确地描述发生了什么。

examples.en: The train arrived precisely at 8:00 a.m.
examples.zh: 火车在早上8点整准时到达。

examples.en: “Precisely!” she replied, meaning “Exactly.”
examples.zh: “正是如此！”她回答道，意思是“没错/完全正确”。

extraExplanation:
“preacidly” 很可能是拼写错误或自动识别（OCR/语音转写）造成的误拼。常见目标词是 “precisely”。

“precisely” 既可以表示“时间/数字等的精确”（precisely at 8:00），也可以在对话中单独说 “Precisely!” 表示“完全正确/正是如此”，语气比 “Exactly!” 更正式一点。

summary.en: A rare/nonstandard coined noun meaning the state before something becomes acidic; usually replaced by clearer phrases like “before acidification.”
summary.zh: 一个很少见/不规范的造词，指“变酸之前的状态”；通常用“酸化之前”等更清楚的说法替代。

definition.en: (Nonstandard/rare) A coined term meaning “the state or period before something becomes acidic.” In most writing, people would instead say “before acidification,” “pre-acidic stage,” or simply describe the pH/conditions.
definition.zh: （非标准/很少用）一种临时造出来的说法，意思是“某物变酸之前的状态或阶段”。更常见的表达是“酸化之前”“前酸性阶段”，或直接描述pH值/环境条件。

examples.en: The report discusses the lake’s preacidness, before pollution lowered the pH.
examples.zh: 报告讨论了这个湖在污染降低pH之前的“未酸化状态”。

examples.en: In most papers, you’d write “pre-acidification conditions” rather than “preacidness.”
examples.zh: 在大多数论文里，你会写“酸化前条件（pre-acidification conditions）”，而不是“preacidness”。

extraExplanation: “preacidness”不是英语里常见或规范的词，通常不会出现在词典中。它看起来像是由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ acid（“酸/酸性的”）+ -ness（名词后缀，表示“……的状态/性质”）拼出来的。
如果你想表达科学语境（环境、化学、食品）里“变酸之前的阶段”，更自然的选择包括：pre-acidification（酸化前）、pre-acidic stage（前酸性阶段）、before acidification（在酸化之前）、baseline pH conditions（基线pH条件）。

summary.en: “Preacknowledge” means to acknowledge or confirm something in advance.
summary.zh: “preacknowledge”指在事情发生或正式确认之前先行承认或确认。

definition.en: to acknowledge something in advance; to confirm or recognize before it officially happens or before receiving something
definition.zh: 预先承认；预先确认（在事情正式发生之前或收到之前先表示确认/认可）

examples.en: Please preacknowledge the policy update before the meeting so we can focus on questions.
examples.zh: 请在会议前预先确认这次政策更新，这样我们就能把时间用在提问上。

examples.en: The system lets users preacknowledge terms and conditions during account setup.
examples.zh: 该系统允许用户在创建账户时预先确认条款与条件。

extraExplanation: “preacknowledge”不是非常常见的标准词，更常见的写法与表达包括“acknowledge in advance / acknowledge beforehand / pre-approve（预先批准）/ pre-confirm（预先确认）”。在正式写作中，建议用更常见的短语来避免读者困惑。
构词上：pre-（在……之前）+ acknowledge（承认/确认）。有时也会看到带连字符的形式“pre-acknowledge”。

summary.en: Preacknowledged means “already acknowledged or confirmed in advance.”
summary.zh: preacknowledged 指“事先已经确认/承认的”。

definition.en: acknowledged in advance; already accepted, recognized, or confirmed before a later step happens.
definition.zh: 预先确认的；事先承认/接受的；在后续步骤发生前就已被确认的。

examples.en: The company uses preacknowledged forms, so customers don’t need to sign again at delivery.
examples.zh: 公司使用预先确认的表格，因此顾客在送达时不需要再签字。

examples.en: Your preacknowledged consent lets us start processing the application immediately.
examples.zh: 你预先确认的同意让我们可以立刻开始处理申请。

extraExplanation: “preacknowledged”由前缀 pre-（提前）+ acknowledged（已确认的）组成，常见于比较正式或流程性的语境（如行政、合同、物流、数据处理）。日常英语里更常用的说法是 “already acknowledged / acknowledged in advance / pre-approved（预先批准的，含义更偏审批）”。

summary.en: A formal term meaning an acknowledgment made ahead of time.
summary.zh: 表示“提前作出的确认/承认”的正式用语。

definition.en: An acknowledgment made in advance (before a later event, receipt, or formal step), often used in formal or legal writing.
definition.zh: （常用于正式或法律语境）预先作出的确认/承认；在某个事件、收件或正式程序之前先行表示确认。

examples.en: The contract requires preacknowledgement of the risks before you sign.
examples.zh: 合同要求你在签署前对风险作出预先确认。

examples.en: Some online forms ask for preacknowledgement of the terms and conditions.
examples.zh: 有些在线表格会要求你先行确认条款与条件。

extraExplanation: “preacknowledgement”较少见，更常见的写法是带连字符的“pre-acknowledgment”（美式拼法）或“pre-acknowledgement”（英式拼法，-ment/-ment一致但acknowledg(e)差异）。
多见于合同、合规、医疗知情同意、保险或网站条款等文本，用来强调“在后续动作之前已被告知并同意/确认”。
在日常英语中更自然的表达常是“acknowledge in advance”或“prior acknowledgment”。

summary.en: “Preacknowledging” means acknowledging something ahead of time.
summary.zh: “preacknowledging”指“提前承认/提前致谢”。

definition.en: acknowledging something in advance (before it happens or before it is formally required).
definition.zh: 预先承认；提前致谢（在事情发生前或正式需要之前先表示承认/认可）。

examples.en: In his speech, he began by preacknowledging the volunteers who made the event possible.
examples.zh: 在演讲中，他一开始就预先致谢了让活动得以举行的志愿者们。

examples.en: By preacknowledging possible mistakes, the team reduced tension during the review.
examples.zh: 通过预先承认可能的错误，团队在评审时缓解了紧张气氛。

extraExplanation: “preacknowledging”较少见，更常见的表达是“acknowledging in advance / acknowledging beforehand”。它常出现在较正式的写作或演讲语境中，用来先把对方可能在意的点（贡献、问题、反对意见等）提前说出来，以显示尊重、降低冲突或铺垫后文。
构词上由前缀“pre-（在……之前）”+“acknowledge（承认/致谢/确认）”组成。

summary.en: A preacknowledgment is an acknowledgment made ahead of time, often in contracts or formal documents.
summary.zh: preacknowledgment 指在事前作出的确认或承认，常见于合同等正式文件中。

definition.en: An acknowledgment given in advance—especially a written confirmation or admission made before a final event, decision, delivery, or legal step.
definition.zh: 预先承认／预先确认——指在最终事件、决定、交付或法律步骤发生之前就作出的（通常是书面的）确认或承认。

examples.en: The supplier asked for a preacknowledgment of the order before shipping the goods.
examples.zh: 供应商要求在发货前先对订单做出预先确认。

examples.en: Some contracts require a preacknowledgment that you understand the risks.
examples.zh: 有些合同要求你预先确认自己理解相关风险。

examples.en: She signed a preacknowledgment stating the payment terms were clear to her.
examples.zh: 她签署了预先确认文件，表示付款条款她已了解清楚。

extraExplanation: “preacknowledgment”不是日常高频词，更常见的写法是加连字符的“pre-acknowledgment”。它多出现在法律、合同、金融或物流语境中，强调“先确认/先同意”，以减少后续争议。
在正式写作里，有时也会用更常见的表达替代，如“advance acknowledgment”“prior acknowledgment”或“acknowledgment in advance”。

summary.en: Preakness usually refers to the Preakness Stakes, a major U.S. horse race and the second leg of the Triple Crown.
summary.zh: Preakness 通常指“普里克内斯锦标赛”，美国重要赛马赛事之一，也是“三冠王”系列的第二场。

definition.en: A famous American Thoroughbred horse race held each year in Maryland, the second race in the U.S. Triple Crown series (officially called the Preakness Stakes).
definition.zh: 美国著名的纯血马赛马赛事，每年在马里兰州举行，是美国“三冠王”系列中的第二场（正式名称为“Preakness Stakes / 普里克内斯锦标赛”）。

examples.en: He watched the Preakness on TV with his family.
examples.zh: 他和家人在电视上一起看普里克内斯赛。

examples.en: The colt won the Kentucky Derby and then headed to the Preakness.
examples.zh: 那匹小公马赢了肯塔基德比，接着去参加普里克内斯赛。

definition.en: The event or race day when the Preakness Stakes takes place (often said as “Preakness Day”).
definition.zh: 指举办普里克内斯锦标赛的那一天或整场活动（常说“Preakness Day / 普里克内斯日”）。

examples.en: Baltimore is especially busy on Preakness weekend.
examples.zh: 在普里克内斯周末，巴尔的摩会特别热闹。

examples.en: They planned a party for Preakness Day.
examples.zh: 他们为普里克内斯日安排了聚会。

extraExplanation: “Preakness”最常见的用法其实是指“Preakness Stakes（普里克内斯锦标赛）”，有时人们会省略为“the Preakness”。它是美国赛马“三冠王（Triple Crown）”中的第二关：Kentucky Derby（肯塔基德比）→ Preakness Stakes（普里克内斯）→ Belmont Stakes（贝蒙特锦标赛）。
在新闻和文学性写作里，常见表达有：“a Derby-Preakness double”（连赢德比与普里克内斯）以及“Triple Crown hopes”（冲击三冠王的希望）。

summary.en: Preacquaint means to acquaint or familiarize someone in advance.
summary.zh: preacquaint 指“事先使熟悉/提前介绍”。

definition.en: to make someone familiar with something or introduce someone in advance; to acquaint beforehand
definition.zh: （事先）使某人熟悉某事；提前介绍/使…认识

examples.en: Before the first day, the teacher preacquainted the new students with the school rules.
examples.zh: 在第一天上课前，老师先让新生熟悉校规。

examples.en: The guide preacquainted us with local customs so we wouldn’t offend anyone.
examples.zh: 导游先让我们了解当地习俗，以免冒犯别人。

extraExplanation: 这个词在现代英语里非常少见，更常用的表达是：acquaint someone with…（使熟悉…）、introduce… beforehand（提前介绍）、brief someone on…（事先简要说明…）。
构词上是 pre-（在前、预先）+ acquaint（使熟悉/使认识）。在正式或旧式书面语中偶尔出现。

summary.en: Preacquaintance means a prior acquaintance or previous familiarity with someone.
